Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	"Thus begins the words of Albucasis."
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	"Oh, sons, since I have fulfilled this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, and by its completion it has reached its end, and by its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I complete it for you with this treatise, which concerns the operation with my hand, that is surgery."
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation with my hand is despised in our region and in our times has been completely abandoned, so that the science of it has become rare, its traces have disappeared; and nothing remains of it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have changed their hands and have deviated from those errors and hesitations so that they are closed off to their intentions and the strength of it is elongated and weakened.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	"And it seems to me that I revive this one with an arrangement of this treatise according to the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and also with forms of cautery tools and other instruments necessary for the work, which is added in the declaration, and by preparation for it, which is necessary."
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	"However, the reason why there is no good artisan with their hands in our time is because the art of medicine is long and its performer should be well-trained beforehand in the science of anatomy, which contains knowledge of the joints of the limbs and their shapes, conjunction, separation of them; and has the knowledge of bones, nerves, and arteries, their number, arrangement, pulsating veins and quiet ones, and places for their discharge."
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	"And therefore Hippocrates said that in the name of U is the cause, but little in the work, especially in the art of the hand."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	"But we have already said about this at the beginning of this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said about anatomy will certainly fall into error and cause many deaths, as I have seen too many times, because some are trained in this science but cast themselves away from it without knowledge or experience."
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	"For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor incise an escrofulous abscess on the neck of a woman and cut some arteries in her neck so that much blood flowed, causing the woman to die suddenly among the masses."
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	"And I saw another doctor who took upon himself to remove a stone from a man who had fallen into that state, and the stone was large; but he came to him and removed that stone along with a piece of the bladder, so that that man died on the third day."
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	"And I had already appealed to him to leave it alone, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the illness, I knew for sure that he would die."
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	"And I saw another doctor who received payment of one ducat from our land for surgery; and he undertook to treat a blacksmith who had a fracture in his hip. And the doctor prepared with his ignorance, removed the fracture on top of the hip bone with pulleys and screws with great force, and did not leave room for respiration."
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	"And he finally released him according to his desires and removed the splint, and also removed the bandage after some days and commanded that we release the ligature; but he did it in such a way that the hip bone became inflamed, causing damage."
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	"And I was called to him and prepared to release the ligature, and thus tranquility came about with the alleviation of his pains."
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	"But nevertheless corruption had already become confirmed in the limb, so that I could not hold it back, and corruption did not cease to wander through the limb until the patient was endangered."
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	"And I saw another doctor who punctured a cancerous abscess and it became ulcerated after some days, causing the evil to spread throughout its owner."
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	"The reason for this is that the cancerous ulcer is caused by black bile, which should not be approached with any iron at all, but rather to the limb that suffers from it must be applied what can expel it."
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	"And therefore, my children, it is necessary for you that the operation with the hand be divided into two parts: some are operations associated with health, and others are works in which there is danger in most situations."
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	"And I have already explained this throughout all parts of this book where operation is mentioned in which there is error and fear; for it is necessary for you to observe this and leave that alone, so that the foolish do not find a way to speak and dishonor you."
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	"And therefore take up your arms with solicitude and protection of God, and your illnesses with patience and steadfastness."
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	"And use the best way by the grace of God to pursue health and successful outcome, leaving behind terrible illnesses with difficult cure; show your arms against what you fear, so that steadfastness in your faith and name may not desert you: for it remains more to your glory, both on earth and in the end, to your sanctity."
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	"Since I have already said in some of my books:"
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"No cure an illness unless you know how to do it well, so that you may not be called a bad doctor."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have already divided this book into three chapters."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Here begins the division of the book, first of the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter ordered is about the head, regarding the forms of instruments and the irons for cautery, and what is necessary in operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"Here begins the second part."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter, about stitching and perforation, about cupping glasses, splints, and extraction of arrows and similar things, all ordered according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"Here begins the third part."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter, about reduction and dislocation, and about the cure of torsion and similar things; chapter ordered regarding the head and the forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"About cautery with fire and with sharp medicine and remembrance of operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"And with that begins the treatise of the entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"It is necessary for me to say what are the effects of that cautery and its harms, and in what condition cautery is prohibited."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the discourse about the quality of cautery's benefit and harm is long and verbose, subtle in science, and secretly hidden; many wise men have already spoken about it, and they disagree with each other on this matter, but I will suffice with a little bit of their discourses, fearing lengthiness."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"And therefore I say that cautery is beneficial universally to every condition, both with matter and without matter, except for two conditions which are conditions of the body without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"The complexion being dry and hot, with matter out of harmony; some said that cautery is beneficial for this, while others said the contrary, that cautery is not suitable in illness caused by heat and dryness."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"That person who says the contrary believes that cautery is beneficial in all dry and hot illnesses that occur in humans' bodies."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say, according to what that person said, I have already experienced this many times."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"But it is not necessary to come back to this topic again since it has already been thoroughly explored in the chapter on cautery by recent authors, and considering the diversity of human complexions, the disposition of illnesses in their various places, their causes, accidents, and duration."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"But in other complexions, there is not much doubt, especially regarding hot and humid illnesses, since all physicians agree on these matters and are unanimous in their judgment using cautery for such conditions."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, my son, that the secret of cure by cautery with fire and its benefits are discussed in medical writings on cautery, because fire acts simply, affecting only the member cauterized and not harming other adjacent members unless there is some injury."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"But the action of cautery reaches only those members from which it is drawn away, and if done forcefully, it can bring difficult-to-cure illnesses into those members."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"But fire, due to its purity and goodness of substance, does not do anything but superfluate. And it is already known to us through experiment and the length of service in studying this art that this is true; therefore, I am excused from discussing it at length here. However, if it were not for the fact that my book on this subject has not yet been published, I would reveal to you in this passage, with philosophical demonstration, the secret of how fire operates on bodies and its expulsion of illnesses."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, my son, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to perform cautery, and they consider the best time to be in spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cautery is appropriate at any time because the accidental harm caused by time is outweighed by the benefit gained from cautery. Especially when cautery is performed for pains or necessary pains, sharp and chronic ones, which do not tolerate delay, since greater harm comes from delaying than from a small injury occurring in the meantime."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And bear this in mind, my son: only the common people and foolish physicians esteem that those illnesses which are cured by cautery have a delayed recovery, considering that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	"And the reason is not as they imagine because cautery is like medicine that alters complexion and dries out humors which are the cause of pain."
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	"But cautery surpasses medicine in its efficacy and virtue of operation, being great because of its power."
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	"But it is possible that the illness might return at some point in time, depending on the complexion of the illness, its location, and the virtue of cautery used. It also depends on how much superfluity has accumulated in the body and what nourishment and influences have been received by the person. However, if cautery is applied to an illness that is subtle and affects a member with few superfluities and humors, such as toothache, it is less likely to return."
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	"And it is commonly said that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this saying is true; however, people do not understand what they mean by it, as they believe that nothing can be cured profitably with medicine or any other cause besides cautery."
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	"And the cause is actually the opposite; the intention behind saying that cautery is the last resort of medicine is not because other treatments fail to help but rather because cautery is used at the end when all other remedies have been exhausted, and it is then that cautery proves effective."
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	"And from now on, understand that when I say cautery is the last resort of medicine, it is not in accordance with the intention understood by the common people and many foolish physicians."
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	"And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they said this not because of any virtue of gold itself, but only for its equality and subtlety of substance."
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	"And they said that the place of cautery does not matter, which is not entirely true because I have proved and experienced that this is only true in certain bodies without others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said. However, when you perform cautery with fire using gold, it is not declared to you how much of it is consumed due to the heat of the gold, nor does it prepare itself to receive friction. And if you adjust the ignition on top of it, the gold melts due to the fire, and sometimes pieces of it fall into the fire, causing the artisan inconvenience."
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	"And for this reason, cautery with iron should be performed more lightly and more precisely to achieve the desired effect."
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	"And I have already arranged this chapter on cautery according to its chapters and those of the head within its powers, so that you may easily find what you desire from it."
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	"On cautery for headache due to coldness and humidity."
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers upon the humidity and frigidity of the servant who suffers from this accident whose two causes are coldness and an abundance of fluent flux, calledorrhea, from the head to the parts of the eyes and ears. It also causes much sleepiness, toothache and stomach pain, and generally all illnesses that come from frigidity, such as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	"You should first instruct the patient to undergo a cleansing purge of the head with medicinal laxatives for three or four nights, as required by their condition and age."
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	"And then tell them to shave their head with a razor. Then have that servant bring the seat between your hands over a cushioned bench and have them place their hands on its surface."
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	"And then place the razor's edge against the palm of your hand, bringing it up to rest at the base of the patient's nose between their nostrils."
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But first, when your middle finger has reached that spot, mark it with a thread and then ignite the olive oil cautery, which is prepared in this way:"
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	"And then place that over the marked spot with such force that your hand is slowly pushed down, and you turn it."
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	"And then raise your hand lightly and look at the spot. If you see any bone exposed there, like a grain of barley, then immediately raise your hand. But if not, return your hand with that iron until you see what I have described to you."
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	"And then take some salt and dissolve it on the spot and leave it for three days."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	"And then place a cotton wick dipped in border oil on the wound, leaving it there until the fire's scar is destroyed."
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress the wound with tetraformacon ointment until it is healed."
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	"When the wound remains open, it is better to raise the arm, as this provides better healing."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	"They said that the nerve should be cauterized inside the bone, and that the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's marrow is heated."
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	"And then it should be scraped until the heat reaches the bone, and then it should be treated."
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	"And others said that when the cautery reaches the bone marrow, it should press hard on the bone until it cracks, and this is the manner of treating small abscesses:"
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	"They believe that from that place, the vapors of the head escape."
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	"And if the wound remains open for a long time, it should be treated until it is consolidated."
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	"But I have not seen these two kinds of cauteries done on everyone, only on some people out of fear; and thus, it seems to me, it is better with health when this is done. For the head is opened by the solution of continuity from this manner, just as we have testified in other members, and more so when the head of the sick person is full naturally."
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	"And the first kind of cautery is safer and better in my opinion, and that is where that work should be done with health."
Capitol segon.	"Chapter Two"
Del cauteri del cap.	"On the cautery of the head."
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	"If chronic and prolonged pain occurs in the whole head of a patient who has long suffered from illness, and despite using various remedies such as plasters, ointments, bandages, and other treatments, there is no improvement, consider if the patient's head was of strong constitution by nature. If this is not the case, cauterize it again with another cautery."
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	"And cauterize that on the horn of their forehead with an ember cautery where the chain breaks off."
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	"Cut the chain and expose the quantity of bone mentioned earlier. Then cauterize it with a cautery at the back of the head where it is called the 'vessel', which is also the location used for applying a cupping glass."
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	"And alleviate your hand in this, do not expose the bone, because the pain caused by this cautery is different from all other cauteries on the head and causes much greater pain."
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And I tell you this cautery in its place, because it is necessary to cauterize the horns of the head and the occupit with a more subtle cautery than that used for cauterizing the middle of the head. This is the form of it."
Capitol ters.	"Chapter on cauteries."
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	"On cauterization for non-classical migraine."
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	"When severe pain occurs in the part of the head or a throbbing pain is felt within it, let it be evacuated with medicines that clear the head. If this does not help, and other treatments are administered without success, then cauterization should be performed in one of two ways: either by cauterizing with an acutely burning medicine or with iron."
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	"The cautery with burning medicine is performed by taking a dish of salt and grinding it until its ends are ground off from both sides."
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	"And then carefully cut the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp lancet that is just enough to expose the chain without cutting it completely."
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	"And then press it with a linen cloth moistened with hot water for about three hours. Then remove the salt and bandage the wound with soft cloth for two or three days. Then compress the area again under wet compresses until the wound heals."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then cure it with an ointment so that it is healed."
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	"And if you wish to do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines."
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"The cautery with iron is performed in this way, and this is its form:"
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	"And it is called closed nails because the head of it is like the shape of a nail with some curvature, and there is a small prominence in its middle."
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	"And then place the hot iron on the location of the pain and hold your hand steady so that the heat does not adhere to the arrow. Then slowly move the iron back and forth at moderate speed."
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	"And if the quantity of iron that adheres to the chain is such that most of it is burned, raise your hand up so that the artery is not burned and does not cause bleeding."
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then immerse the area in salt water and apply it to the location, leaving it there for three days. Then compress the area with a warm cloth and cure it with an ointment until it is healed."
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	"If you wish to cauterize the extreme point of the temple according to cautery, be careful not to incise the artery in this type of non-classical migraine."
Capitol quart.	"Chapter Four."
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	"On the cauterization of ancient migraines."
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	"When you treat migraine as we have said in the previous treatment and in the sections on illnesses, and the treatment does not help, sometimes due to the severity of the illness, the first cautery with medicine or fire is not enough. Therefore, you should heat the temple cautery until it is red hot. Then place your hand on the location of the pain for a moment and press it until you incise the artery and cause blood to flow into the mouth."
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	"However, it is necessary for you to protect the continuation of the jawbone, which is moved during mastication, and that the muscle is not adhered to and that no spasms occur."
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	"And if it is about the care and caution regarding the flow of blood from the artery that is opened, for there is fear in its opening, especially for those who do not know what they are doing and are not studious and experienced. Leave the operation to someone at the beginning."
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	"And I bring back to memory the method of stopping accidental bleeding from the artery according to its way, in its proper place in this book."
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"If you see this illness that does not improve with this cautery and the patient's constitution is tolerable, cauterize in the middle of the head as we have described, and cure the wound until it is healed."
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	"If you wish, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on the stopping of bleeding with cautery using two tweezers, for this is better cauterization and more effective."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Five."
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	"On the cauterization of ear pains."
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	"When there is pain in the ear due to friction and it is treated with laxative causes and other treatments that have been mentioned in the division, but the pain persists, then heat the cautery called puncture, of which this is the form:"
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	"And then puncture around the ignition point, and guide it around the entire ear like a wheel being turned, or make circuits around each one if the pain is in both."
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	"Proceed slowly with the cautery of the rim of the ear little by little, so that you feel the location with caution."
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	"And if you make dots with the cautery all around the ear and leave it like that, then cure those locations until they are healed."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter Six."
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Burning of the throat
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tumor that is treated and cured by cautery is only of those species that come through the blood vessels, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery for the species that arrives dry or due to spasm of the nerve
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that kind of tumor with remedies and purgatives and warm drinks, and your treatment does not bring about healing, then you should cauterize the disease with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, the second a little below the forehead temple, and the third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cautery for the opposite of where the disease started, because softening happens only in the part that appears healed.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cautery is that you cauterize there with the cautery in the right side of the extreme tip of the ear above a little over the horn of the head, and on the other temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the thumb, and then pause your hand with the cautery until about half of the species of the bone is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cautery, which is a species of the cutlery trade, the form of which is as follows:
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it would be much more subtle if you could see it this way; and sometimes it's necessary to cut away excess thickness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And afterwards, treat the place with whatever is prescribed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	"Chapter Seven."
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	"Regarding the cautery of ancient apoplexy."
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and treated with what we have said without causing fever in the patient, then cauterize him with four cauteries: over all his temples; and with a cautery on the middle of his head as we have said; and with a cautery on his neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of cauterizing is done as has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	Then cauterize over the mouth of the stomach, and if it is worse, then treat him with what you proceed to do
Capitol .viii.	Capitulum viii
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Concerning the cauterization for forgetfulness caused by a stroke.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	At first give him large jars and purgative pills to cleanse him
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the whole head of the patient and apply to his neck the plaster made of ceter described in the treatise on plasters
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for that is the manner of cauterizing.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to that measure which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he is healed well by that, do so. And if not, then give him three cauteries on the back part of his head, descending from the highest part of his head down to the lowest part of his neck
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause between each cautery for the thickness of a finger, and then treat the burn with what you have proceeded to do
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if the patient cannot tolerate that much, then give him a cautery in the middle of his head. And if he can tolerate more, then cauterize him over both temples
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat him until he is healed; and let the cauteries be olive-shaped according to the form given before
Capitol .ix.	Capitulum ix.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	"Of cauterization of parasites and softening of the entire body."
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	"That you proceed with the cauterization of the head with fire and with water as we have said; and immediately seize the patient's head, and immediately cauterize that with a cautery in the middle of the head, and cauterize it on all the corners of the head, and cauterize it on the back part of it, and cauterize three times on the shoulders of the neck."
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	"And if it is necessary in the illness for mollification of the body because that one is too hot and the illnesses are tolerating and the illness is strong, then cauterize them with four cauteries on the shoulders of the back, and afterwards cauterize them between the nape of their neck and their shoulders, and raise their head up."
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	"And immediately heal that one which is healed, and this shall be cautery with olive oil."
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	"On Cauterization for Epilepsy."
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	"Epilepsy is not cauterized unless it is due to phlegm."
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	"Therefore, it is necessary to cleanse the brain at the beginning of the treatment and in the other cure that we have mentioned in the division when the patient is big and tolerant except for the exception of medicines."
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	"And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargarisms and mastigators to cleanse the throat, beforehand for several days, with beneficial foods."
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	"And also burn the head of the patient, and burn it with a cautery in the middle of the head according to the aforementioned manner, and with another cautery on the occupit of it, and on each horn of the head burn."
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	"And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then burn it with cauteries that I have mentioned, having paralysis and softening of the body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back."
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	"Let it be cauterized with olive oil according to what has been said beforehand."
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	"But if the patient is a child, then pause cauterizing subtly in this manner."
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moisture and thick bile, then cauterize it with the cauteries mentioned earlier in paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	If the cause of melancholy is declining superfluity leading to it, and the patient's body is humid, then let them drink what cleanses the brain according to what has been mentioned earlier in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And properly shave the patient's head, and also make a poultice decently from it over the circle, and properly apply that poultice in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated, and held down on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And also apply a liniment; afterwards, it is fitting to bind with wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire for gentle heating according to measure, which the said patient endures when it is most in them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And afterwards place that in the middle of the head within the circle, and let it lie there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once every week, but with the other regimen of the boil until it is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that making little points according to how much of it there is, ensuring that your hand holds a cautery arranged thus: this is a species of cautery which moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And also bind that wound with cloth or gauze.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterizing descending water in the head
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it has been declared to you that water has begun to descend into the head through the signs which have been mentioned in this division, then begin and give the patient to drink what cleanses the brain of him, and guard him from all humidities.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him be subjected to bathing with decoction for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then order him to raise his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and also cauterize that with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of descent of water into both heads, or on one side if it is the beginning of the descent of water into one head.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize with cauteries all veins and arteries which are below the nape, and let the cauteries be placed at that distance along the line of latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against fluxes of blood when it is cauterized; and if you see any fluxes of blood, stop them with some medicine which is at your disposal.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I come with wisdom which is in extraction of arteries and in excision of those, and in caution about fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the brain between two bones with two cauteries producing copiously.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	"On the burning away of ancient tears."
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	"When tears from the eyes are abundant and flow through the veins and arteries that are visibly present in the head, and it is confirmed that this is a superfluous fluid matter, then cauterize that area with a cautery, which we have described at the beginning of the chapter on hot water in the eyes. Cauterize the middle of the head and two spots behind the temples, and two spots behind the ears."
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	"And if needed, cauterize that area on both sides of the eye socket above the eyebrow with a small cautery."
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	"On cauterizing the foul odor from the nose."
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	"If you treat someone with what we have mentioned in the section and it does not help, then prepare and give them this mixture to drink for three nights: ..., and then shave their head and cauterize it with a cautery made of mastic mixed with olive oil."
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	"And also cauterize that area with a clove cautery, placing two cauteries on both eyebrows above the hair."
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	"Be careful not to burn that area."
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	"And this is how you make a clove cautery:"
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	"For cautery of softening of eyelid inflammation."
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened due to illness or moisture, cauterize that eyelid with this silver cautery device, and this is how it should be done:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	"If you must, cauterize above both eyebrows using two small cauteries on each side, avoiding the temples."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	"And let the length of each cautery be proportional to the thickness of the eyebrow."
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	"Press the cautery gently against the skin without burning more than a third of the eyelid."
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	"Regarding cauterizing the eyelids when hairs grow inward and pierce the eye."
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	"When the hairs of the eyelid grow inward and pierce the eye, cauterize them in either of two ways: either with fire or with medicine."
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	"If cauterizing with fire, instruct the patient beforehand to extend his eyelashes like those that are combed out, until they are lengthened and hardened. And if any hairs emerge during this process, then stretch the eyelids using a bandage so that no harm is caused while waiting for them to grow."
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	"When the hairs have grown and hardened, then pause the patient's head in a suitable position, and holding the eyelid taut with your thumb, place the cautery upon it. The beginning of the cautery should be shaped like a sickle of iron, placed close to where the hairs begin."
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	"And then pause cotton dipped in alum or in mucilage of hartshorn on the eye."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And then ignite the cautery which has this shape:"
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	"And then cauterize along the shape marked here, little by little, with repeated motions, until the surface of the line resembling a myrtle leaf is entirely consumed."
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	"The sign of the cure being accomplished is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted, and its hairs raised up from the puncture of the eye."
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	"And then raise your hand and leave it alone for three days. After that, pause a cotton bandage on it until the scar is healed."
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress it with ointment until it is healed."
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the eyelid returns to its previous position due to some cause and is softened, then apply the cautery again on that spot as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the eyelids are stuck to the eyelid, then cauterize that area which is elevated to its natural location and swollen, so that the eyelids do not stick together.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	If the cautery with medicine is used to burn this area that you command the patient to lift the eyelids which are prolonged and swollen, then a piece of cloth like a mint leaf should be placed nearby.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take some known soap and live coal on a needle tip, mix them quickly so that it does not cool down, spread this mixture on the cloth shaped like a mint leaf, place it on one or both eyelids, then place cotton wool dipped in egg white on the other eye, and keep the patient's head tilted back.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Place your finger on the medicine and press it lightly, but do not rub it in while the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the sensation is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And once the burning sensation is felt, then remove the medicine and wipe it with your finger; when the burning sensation stops, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water. Then observe if the eyelid has been lifted as it was before, in which case you should cauterize or cut the constriction with fire, for it is now at its best. And if not, place the medicine back on the location where it had not previously adhered until the swelling subsides and your operation is completed and the eye is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place cotton soaked in boric acid or another suitable solution over it until the inflammation of the adhesion is erased, and then dress it with a suitable ointment or another substance until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to be very diligent in your operation that no medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid becomes inflamed over several days and some cause of hairs puncturing the eye occurs, then repeat your medication on that location where the eyelid has become inflamed, just as you did at the beginning, until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method for treating a cataract.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that men's eyes are diverse in size and smallness, and therefore your cautery should be done accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the path of correctness from anyone who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cautery for a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	"When you treat fistula as we have described in the divisions of diseases and your treatment does not succeed, then you must cauterize it in this manner: Command the patient to place their head on your thigh, and hold their head steady with one hand between their teeth so that they are neither moved nor agitated by their own head."
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	"And then place hot wax or pitch plaster on the wound on the head."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"Furthermore, this is the form of the cautery you will use:"
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	"The cautery should be hollow, like a reed or a vulture's feather tip, at the end of which you will perform the cautery."
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	"Furthermore, if you wish, it may also penetrate into the other extremity."
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	"And if you want, let it be like this: as if tending."
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	"But truly, that which is hollow is better for your task."
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Approximately press the fistula if it is open, and draw out its pus and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it is not open, then tear it open and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then press the cautery which has been well ignited onto it and hold it there for a moment, but not too long at the end of the nose so that you do not burn your hand or disturb the patient, and then immediately place the cautery in the ashes and extinguish it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cautery you perceive that it enters into the bone, then that is good. Otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice more if necessary; and leave it thus for three days, and again press on that spot with a border and around it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then apply a medicine that is sharply corrosive to it until the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what seems appropriate in this chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of cauterizing a fistula which some doctors first described: enter the place where the fistula is and open it up, and immediately insert into that opening a very subtle probe whose shape corresponds to its form. Then pour into that as much melted lead as you can hold in your hand with caution so that the patient does not suffer too much so that the melted lead does not reach the wound; and cover the wound of the patient with a bandage dipped in album of egg or water, because lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, then that is good. Otherwise, it is necessary to administer traction of the nose and reduce the fistula into the body of the nose according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cauterization of the split hoof.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times it happens that splits occur in the lips, and more often in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	"Therefore, when treating those fissures with what we have mentioned in the divisions and your treatment proves ineffective, then apply a small cautery knife in this manner which is shown."
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	"And it should be curved according to the subtlety of a needle."
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	"Then pause your hand carefully in those fissures until the cautery reaches the front of the fissure."
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	"And then cure that wound until it is healed."
Capitol .xix.	"Chapter XIX."
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	"On the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth."
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"When an aposteme forms on the uvula or palate or roots of teeth, and it bursts and is cleaned out, and then breaks open again, and a fistula forms, if you cure it but the cure does not take effect, then it is necessary to cauterize it according to the amount that has been received in the fistula. Then put that hot iron into the mouth of the fistula, keeping your hand inside until the hot iron reaches the front of it. Repeat this process once or twice more; and then cure it with what we have said about curing until it is healed."
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	"And if the wound heals and is sound, that is good. But if not, then it is necessary to uncover the place and remove the rotten bone according to what is written in its chapter."
Capitol .xx.	"Chapter XX."
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	"On the cauterization of teeth and the softening of gum boils."
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When gums are softened by moisture and teeth are painful, and you treat them with medicines without success, then place the patient's head on the table, and immediately apply the cautery of this form: thus you will place the tweezers over the tooth and quickly insert the ignited cautery into that area, keeping your hand a little withdrawn so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And immediately remove your hand, and repeat the application of the cautery several times according to what you desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and keep it in for an hour, then spit it out, because the painful tooth will be solidified, the softened gum tightened, and the harmful moisture dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness, or there's decay in the teeth, and medicine does not relieve it, then cauterization in that area may be done in two ways: either with a hot iron from cattle dung, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	To cauterize with a hot iron from cattle dung: Take some cattle dung, roll it into the shape of an iron ball, and place it on the glowing end of the tongs. Then quickly wrap that end in cotton cloth, and apply it to the painful tooth, pressing firmly until it becomes cold again.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	"And then repeat this several times until the power of fire reaches the root of the teeth."
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	"And if you wish, soak some wool or cotton in the border of the powder above and place it on the painful tooth, then place a heated iron on top until the iron reaches the point of the concavity of the tooth."
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	"However, you should wait until the coal or iron is hot enough before cauterizing with fire. Make sure it has reached the center and that its heat does not reach the patient's mouth."
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	"And then heat the cautery iron to its proper shape and place it on the tooth with your hand until it cools down. Do this several times, once or twice a day, until the pain disappears."
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	"And it is necessary that after this cauterization, the patient should rinse his mouth well and hold it closed for an hour. Then he should spit it out; and this is the form of cauterization."
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	"And cauterize with whatever you wish according to what seems best to you."
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	"And this is the shape of the cannula:"
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of exstrophic defects
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	"When exstrophic defects are caused by friction and fluids that do not heal well with medicines and you wish to promote digestion of those, then heat the cautery iron to its proper shape, which is as follows: it should have two openings at its ends so that smoke can come out through one opening while the other remains closed. Place the heated cautery on the exstrophe once or twice until it reaches the point of the defect."
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	"And if the exstrophe is small, then place the cautery accordingly, according to its size. Then leave it alone for three days and place it on the edge of the wound, pressing it down until what the fire has burned is healed."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with ointments and dressings until it is healed."
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	"And the shape of the cautery iron for such use should be like this:"
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	"For cauterization of vocal cords and constriction of breath."
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	"When humidity reaches the lung canal, especially when it's accompanied by cold weather, first, the patient should be given laxative medicines and then cauterize that area with a hot iron in the depressed place."
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	"And make sure that you do not burn through to the gut or scorch the spine, but only lightly cauterize it."
