"And that which indicates a penetrating fistula into the anus and a non-penetrating one is when you insert your finger into the anus, and when there is not tortuosity, insert a thin probe of earthenware or iron into the fistula."
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	"But if there is tortuosity in that one, then insert into it a thin probe of lead or horsehair until you feel the probe or the hair on your finger."
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	"And if you do not feel it at all and there is no evidence of exit or worms or windiness from the anus, as we have said, then know that it is non-penetrating. And then proceed to treatment."
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	"And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the urethra, then its sign is the exit of urine from it. And prohibition of it until that place has healed with medicine."
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	"But if it is penetrating into the vulva or into the bone and accompanied by pain in the area, then its sign is that a probe passed into it here does not have tortuosity. And there is pain in the area of the bone; and there is always putrefaction from it; and no medication is beneficial for it, nor can it be consolidated with grease."
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	"And in all those penetrating fistulas there is no complete cure. And the treatment of these is difficult and beyond the ability of many physicians."
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	"But in that which is not penetrating and not ancient, healing with iron is hoped for according to what I will recommend to you, and what I have already said and proven."
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	"And it is that the condition affects you between your buttocks, mainly over the two bones, elevates the cheeks of the buttocks internally, and inclines the vulva towards its belly. And then insert a probe of lead or earthenware if there is tortuosity in the fistula, until you know where the probe passes."
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	"And if that condition affects around the anus, then it is necessary for you to insert your finger into the anus."
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you feel the probe already penetrating through your finger itself, other than what you feel between your finger and that siphac or flesh, then know for certain that it is penetrating. And do not treat it there, because there is no healing of it, as we have said."
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	"However, some say that it is beneficial in certain cases."
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	"For the treatment in which improvement is hoped, you should cauterize with fire subtly according to the width of the fistula, as is described above, and insert that heated metal into the fistula until it reaches around the bone; and repeat this process two or three times until you know that all those flesh tissues surrounding the fistula have been burnt, which resemble a bird's feather quill."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	"And then dress that with damp cloths wrapped in wool until all those burnt flesh tissues have healed, and then treat it with medicines that generate and consolidate flesh, and if it has healed, good; but if not, at that time it will not heal with any other treatment."
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	"And if the probe enters and does not penetrate within the aforementioned opening which is in the anus, and there is between that and the probe a veil of skin or membrane, then close up that fistula so that its surface area matches the thickness of the probe; then cut off the probe at the beginning of the fistula, and you will see it dried with the probe inside the fistula until the section reaches the place where the end of the probe had reached, and through the probe it is freed and removed."
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	"And then cleanse those flesh tissues that resemble a bird's feather quill with the cautery without breaking any of them due to some cause."
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	"But if pus starts flowing between you and your operation while dissecting those flesh tissues, then it is good that it should be cauterized with fire or with a sharp instrument, because cauterizing with fire has two advantages: it is an adjustment of those flesh tissues that have adhered, and it is evacuation of the pus, and drying of the moisture."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	"And then treat it with damp cloths wrapped in wool or fine linen until the place becomes warm, and at that time treat the wound with soft flesh-generating and consolidating ointments."
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	"And these are medicines in which astringency and drying are predominant; when the wound has healed, it is restored and there will be no recurrence."
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	"But if the fistula has already reached the perineum and is elongated from the surface of the skin, then insert the probe into the anus and explore with it."
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	"And then if the probe meets and there is between it and the veil of skin or membrane an obstruction to penetration, then it is not an operation on that site but rather through trust and hope."
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	"And there are three ways to deal with this: either cauterize it in the way we have described; or dry it up until it achieves concavity so that you can enter your probes and perform the cure proposed; and do not proceed with cutting lest you injure the contents of the colon, and thus cause discomfort through a surgical intervention without consent. And then treat it with what has been said because it will be healed quickly if done correctly. Or else dissect that veil and clean out that pus which dries up within the anus in the way we have described, either with a probe or with another instrument of sharp point; and then cleanse those fistulous flesh tissues which are in the section through cautery. And then make sure to restore all the wound with cutting, and if the opening above is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open at the partition of the anus, and pus continues to flow from it."
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	"And some fistulas are ended in this way: when you insert the probe into the fistula, and it goes towards the side of the anus around the surface of the skin with the cord and the margin of the anus, then take a probe with a perforated tip, which is like a needle for preparing hearts in this shape:"
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	"and insert it into that vein wrapped in veins or around those; and then insert the probe with a thread into the fistula until it achieves concavity."
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	"But if it penetrates into the margin of the anus backwards, then you extract that thread from that tract in such a way that you insert your little finger into the anus; and pull out the end of the thread and tie the two ends together, and burn each one separately, and leave it like that for one or two days. And when you incise the thread in the flesh, burn it well so that those flesh tissues which are between the two ends of the thread and which have been injured may be healed."
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	"And then treat the wound until it is consolidated and healed."
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	"But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate in whatever way you are prepared to do so, but do not do it too deeply into the perineum, lest you injure the colon. And then treat it until it is healed."
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	"The shape of the spatula used to split open the fistula is like this: its curvature is very sharp and the other end is not sharp, so that you do not injure anything unnecessary, as happens sometimes."
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	"About the suturing of hemorrhoids from which blood flows in the incision of those."
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	"Hemorrhoids are of two kinds: for some are between the buttocks and resemble coal, or else those which have the appearance of fatty tumors."
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	"And some are small and large, and blood flows from them continuously, and they are singular or multiple, and they are outside the anus or at its extremities."
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	"But those hemorrhoids that are outside the anus are according to the laws of little moisture, from which yellow water or a little blood flows continuously, and they are according to the color of the body."
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	"The treatment for those hemorrhoids that are inside the anus is to have the patient sit down and squeeze so that the anus empties out and the hemorrhoids appear to you."
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	"Then you take hold of them with forceps or with your fingers and suspend them, and then incise them at their roots."
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	"But if the forceps do not hold them because of the moisture and softness of those hemorrhoids, then take them with rough cloth or with cotton or with a wool pad, and extract them with your fingers, and then incise them and sprinkle some powdered myrrh on them at the incision so that they may adhere to them instead of cauterizing; or else cauterize them according to what has been said in the chapter on cauterization."
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And then treat those with another cure until they are healed."
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	"And if the anus does not obey to evacuation, then have the patient rinse with a small rinsing syringe and wash it with water that is in the anus so that it may easily evacuate when the patient squeezes."
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is light, and it is because you take them with your fingernail or with forceps and incise them, and then treat them with what has been said until they are healed."
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	"And if you make an incision, then you must administer a suture to them in this way: take thread wrapped and insert it into the needle and then extract the hemorrhoids from the parts above and make the thread penetrate with the needle into the root of the other part, and wrap both ends of the thread around the part below the needle, and tie the hemorrhoid tightly, and cut the thread."
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	"And do this to all of them, and leave one and do not tie it, so that the excess blood may flow from that one."
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	"And then apply over the anus a cloth dipped in rose oil or cerate, and have the patient rest on their back."
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then let that one enter what box; and when it's closed, care for those with gentleness or with another cure until they are healed."
De curacio de fistulas.	"On the treatment of fistulas."
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	"Very often, fistulas occur due to excessive dryness or by nature's constriction."
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	"And since those remedies are old and do not work in this medicine, you should now use a spatula point or your fingernail to penetrate into the fistulas so that they become humid and then remove the pus on top of them, which prevents consolidation. Then treat them until they are consolidated."
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	"Now you remove as much pus as possible with the first entrance so that it does not sanctify and they are healed. Then treat them until they are healed."
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	"On the treatment of haemorrhoids, this is the key:"
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	"Know that haemorrhoids are like keys and if they are not red, they resemble the head of a nail. They occur throughout the body but more so in areas near the buttocks and genitals, where they cause pain."
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	"And then you should excise what resembles the head of the key with scissors or a nail clipper, and remove it from its root. Then treat it."
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	"If you wish, cauterize the second one that is precedent in its chapter."
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	"Verruca is a small, rough, fistulated elevation on the surface of the body, often seen in many children."
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	"The treatment for it is to stretch and excise that, or shave it with a file or tweezers until it bleeds."
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	"And if you wish, cauterize it with fire or with an acute medicine, as we have said."
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	"And already these growths and non-growths should be eradicated using the instrument that I will now mention."
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	"Molluscum is a small, fatty or fistulated elevation on the surface of the body, occurring mostly on the face. When it is rubbed against, it feels like an ant bite and it spreads around the body."
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	"The treatment for it is to take a quill of an owl or eagle feather and make it strong. Place the feather on the molluscum so that its circle encloses the parts around it. Then rotate your hand with the quill to excise what is around the molluscum, pressing down on the skin, and eradicate the molluscum from its root."
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	"And if you wish, do this using a needle made of bronze or iron as follows:"
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	"The opening of the urinary canal should be drawn out with care, closed (so that it is not perforated), wrapped in such a way that the said part can be washed and rinsed."
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	"And if you wish to cauterize the wound as mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery."
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	"Regarding the shape of the instruments used for giving Communion."
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	"Some Communion wafers are made of silver or pewter or melted lead; and sometimes they are made in various sizes according to those who are administering them, for the one used in the care of small children should be small; and those for sick people or the dying, their wafers should also be small."
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	"The shape of Communion wafers is large and few:"
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	"The head of the cannula through which the purse is tied should be wide in this manner; and let it be at that distance where the purse is tied, as you see fit."
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	"And the bottom end of the probe, which is inserted into the anus, should be blunt (i.e. not open) with a certain amount of subtlety; and on one side of it there are two grooves, and on the other side there is one groove, and the width of the groove should correspond to the thickness of the ray or probe, according as it is thicker or thinner."
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	"And let the bag in which medicines are placed for urinary tract disorders or made from sheep's skin, and its opening should be one palm wide."
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	"And let it be pierced with many holes as it is rolled up; and the space between the holes should be about the thickness of a finger."
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	"And appropriate put into those holes strong strings of flax thread which are made of ten threads, or wind them around them; and fasten the bag with that; and when the bag is placed in it, tighten it at the head of the wafer between two distances with strong constriction, and crimp it with that each string: But know that the quality of crimping it is such that you fill the medicine bag which has been heated according to the quantity of the patient's tolerance; and see to it that it is not too hot nor too cold."
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	"And then the patient should lie on their back and elevate their hips up high, and place beneath them one cover upon which will be the bed or cloth; and appropriate anoint the extremity of the cautery with oil or egg albumen or fenugreek mucilage or similar substances; and appropriate insert it into the anus gently; and then the assistant takes the bag and squeezes it strongly two or three times until all that is in the probe is expelled from the bowel; and then remove the probe, and the patient lifts their hips up against the wall."
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	"And if the medicine forces that out, hold it until it stops flowing; and if they sleep with it like that all night long, it is better for their recovery."
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	"But if you cauterize it in cases of diarrhea and abdominal pain where the cautery comes out with pus, then repeat the cautery until it is healed."
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	"And if there are hemorrhoids or ulcerated anal fissures, then the probe should be very fine and smooth like those with which children are cauterized."
De curacio de las plaguas.	"Regarding the treatment of plagues."
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	"I have already said in the division on the treatment of plague what was necessary for the book, and I say thus the treatment of those with more severity and medicines according to their degree."
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	"Therefore, I say that plague is differentiated according to what part of the body the plague affects and according to the location on which the plague appears."
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	"And the causes for which plague often occurs are such as injury by stone, or incision by sword or knife, or piercing with lance, club, arrow, or other similar causes."
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	"But plague that occurs in the different parts of the body are such as plague that affects the head, neck, chest, belly, thigh, and similar to those of the limbs."
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	"And I am recounting the treatment of some plague because this reasoning and rule apply to other plague as well."
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	"And I will begin with simple head wounds, for the memory of those that are compound will come at the beginning of the third chapter."
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	"Therefore, I say that when a simple head wound occurs and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is from an injury by stone or similar, and the chain has broken only on one side and it is large and you suspect that there may be an abscess forming later on that patient, then immediately perform trepanation of the cephalic vein and flebotomy; do not delay this. And extract from that blood according to the quantity of its virtue if no other cause prohibits flebotomy, especially if little blood comes out of the wound."
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	"And the flebotomy should be on the opposite side from where the wound is located; and keep the patient from being hit, drinking wine or strong drinks, and eating heavy foods."
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	"But if due to minuteness you prohibit any cause, then reduce the food and do not approach it with meat or wine."
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	"And pause over the wound if an abscess forms later on; cut off the hair around it and apply hot oil or wine in which has been steeped some styptic substance."
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	"But if you are sure of an abscess forming later on, then pause over the wound while it is still fresh with its blood and before the air has changed that powder which I will recommend to you appropriately."
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	"And if the air has already changed it, then pause over the abscess until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	"But if the wound is large or it is from an incision by sword or similar and the edges are not adapted for pus, then adapt those edges with sutures according to what I will recommend regarding the suture of wounds."
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	"But if the wound is already exposed to bone and membrane, and there is only a small suspension of it, then incise that and appropriately treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh appropriately in place of chain; and command the patient to be fed on foods that are coarse: heads of cabbage and similar ones until it is composed."
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	"And if you find putrefaction in the chain and it does not adhere to the bone, then incise all that is rotting and throw that out, and appropriately treat it."
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	"But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flow can occur and it is not severed by medicines, then inquire about the artery; and if you find that it has not been incised, then incise that with a spatula or ligate it. And if necessity provokes that what we have said does not conform, then cauterize until the blood is severed."
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	"And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light. Therefore, you powder those with this powder, for it solidifies that before the air changes it."
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	"And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of sesame one part, dragon's blood three parts, and un-extinguished incense five parts; grind it all together and sift it, and with it fill the wound, and constrain it well until it adheres to it, and coagulate it with the blood."
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	"And appropriately constrain that from above with powders and leave it; do not remove it while it is like this until it becomes an abscess because the medicine does not eradicate it before it is healed."
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	"And sometimes you can use just cautery when you do not have incense and dragon's blood available."
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	"During great plagues, perform this operation: place and tighten them over those areas; these recent plague sores have not been altered by the air."
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And if the air has altered them, especially in summer time, it is not intended to use this powder. Instead, treat those with the remedy we mentioned earlier: apply a poultice made from honey and flour mixed with water or apply an ointment made from these ingredients. Also treat them with another cure until they are healed."
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	"And if there happens to be a small bone fracture during the plague, then do this: extract it using gestures."
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	"And you should say that there is no cure for skull fractures in this case."
De las plaguas del col.	"Regarding plague of the neck:"
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	"But if the plague happens in the neck, there is no difference in treatment between that and simple head plague."
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	"But if the nerves or arteries of the neck are cut, then if it is a nerve, there is nothing to be done except to avoid treatment with anything that causes vehement constriction, such as zinc and vitriol. These things resemble them in color and can cause paralysis."
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	"And do not apply any treatment for plague caused by heat, because the substance of nerves is hot and their continuation is with the brain, which is the source of all members."
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	"And if it is treated with light medicines, such as washing with sweet water, sometimes mixed with rose or non-rose oil, and turpentine when washed with sweet water, and other stones ground in this way, and moistened."
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	"But if the plague is large, then stitches should be applied, or the lips of it closed, and afterwards treat it with powders until it is healed."
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	"But if there is depth in the plague or it has happened at a low point that has become corrupted, then perforate it where it is most pressed."
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	"But if an artery has been cut in the plague and there is bleeding, then separate or dry it out, ligate it, or cauterize it if necessary to provoke it."
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the vertebrae of the neck have been injured or all, and if the veins of the neck are saved, then sew up the lips of the wound over the spine of the neck and do not touch that; afterwards equalize it and reduce it to its natural figure, and then strengthen it with decent strapping, leaving it for a few days; afterwards treat it with things that have constriction and excitation until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	"But if the plague has already reached the bone and caused damage, then percuss it, and if there are fragments of bone in it, remove all that you can; and what cannot be removed, leave it until the plague putsrefies, separates, and its inflammation is alleviated."
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	"And if the plague is fresh, then powder it with that powder which I have recommended to you."
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	"But if there is a fistula in the plague, then treat it with what is remembered above in its chapter."
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	"About plague of the neck or similar ones when they occur between the shoulders and are made with a razor or with a knife or with a lance or similar."
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	"If it is a wound from a lance or a knife and the depth of it is not known, then consider whether there is wind coming out of the plague when the patient breathes; if so, know that the plague is mortal."
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	"And if it is not deep and the plague is fresh with its own blood, then pause in it for the first hour with the powder recommended above, and do not strengthen it so that the blood is not retained in the depth of it and does not return to the heart and aggravate the illness, but rather pause in it with attractive ointment, and cleanse it twice a day."
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	"And if the ointment is not available to you, then pause in the opening of the plague with cotton moistened so that it may absorb what comes out from the humidities; and make sure that the patient sleeps on the plague so that what is collected in it may flow."
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	"But if three days or more have passed since the plague and no spasms or palpitations of the heart or constriction of the lung occur in the patient, and all other conditions are good, then know that the plague is saved; and therefore treat it with poultices and the other treatment until it is healed."
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	"But if its healing is delayed and a long time has passed, then know that there is already a fistula; therefore treat it according to its chapter."
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	"And if the plague is from an incision made with a razor or a knife and is simple on the surface of the flesh or the back, then treat it with what has been mentioned above about suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small."
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	"But if there has already been damage to the bone and small pieces have formed in it, then turn the plague inside out and try to extract those pieces if they are separated."
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	"But if they are not separated, then leave them until the plague putsrefies, as extraction of them will be alleviated."
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	"And for other accidental wounds in the other members, their treatment is the same as what has been said above."
De las plaguas del ventre.	"About wounds of the belly."
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	"The condition that occurs in the belly is either great, or small, or moderate."
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	"From the great openings viewed are seen the bowel or nerve of the bowel, for which is made intrusion of them and the suture of them to be more vehement and more subtle."
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	"Request for disruption is made difficult by another manner, and so it seems that the reduction of them is more difficult if you do not immediately return them to their own place, because they break and swell up so that the introduction of them becomes difficult."
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	"And therefore the best disruption is middle, because in that one the reduction of the bowel is not difficult, as it is difficult in the two species before mentioned."
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	"And know that suture of the belly is done in four manners, but two sutures are common that are useful in sutures of the other wounds of the body."
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	"And the two other proper sutures communicate with others, but however they are more proper in the suture of the belly."
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	"And I recount to you each one with exposition and declaration."
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	"Therefore I say that when the wound is small and some cause of the bowel comes out through it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this is in one of two manners: either by the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the bowel has come swelling up because of the coldness of the air."
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	"And therefore when this is so, it is necessary that you scarify that until you immerse a sponge or wet cloth in hot water only, or you take it in water with soap, and cypers, and spice, and embrocations with that the swelling may be resolved."
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	"And sometimes this is done in wine, where there is astringency, and it is better that the water alone in the resolution of the swelling."
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	"And therefore when you see that the swelling is resolved, then you moisten the bowel with water in which white althea and mallow are cooked, because by this it is eased from within with few causes."
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	"But if the bowel has not been emptied from its contents by this treatment, then incise the disruption a little with an instrument with which you can cut out hemorrhoids."
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	"And the first cure is better when it is appropriate that there is no sectioning, and there is no occupation to cut off except necessity and deficiency."
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	"Regarding the instrument, see its form:"
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	"The one end of it is cut acute and the other not acute, and the extremity is subtle but not too much so as to be like a spatha, rather let it be blunt somewhat."
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	"And therefore when the wound is enlarged and the bowel comes out, then its reduction should be according to its natural form, in its proper place if that is possible, because it is better."
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	"But when the disruption is large and it is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on his back and raise his hips up as high as his head; but if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should raise his head and place him on his side."
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	"And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two sides of the belly, then you should always have your intention and consideration towards this so that the part where the wound is may be raised up more than the other."
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	"And thus it is necessary that you administer this in large wounds and in medium-sized wounds."
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	"And in small wounds, pause what is prepared for you, and let it be that the minister between your hands is between the most skilled ones, who will hold the disruption entirely with his hand and adjust the lips of it, and let him uncover from this to that which secures some cause or other."
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	"And this is the common way of suturing: one that you take the needle or count of needles according to the quantity of the breadth of the wound; and then leave it at the extremity of the disruption from the ring finger, and thread the needle through once, but do not put a knot on both ends of the cord, with two ends of the ciphac which is left the cord of the parts within, until you have made that penetrate that part; and you already have four orders done."
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	"And then thread with double thread around the needle, and sometimes two parts together, and then join both lips and the wound by a decent joining; and then leave the thickness of the finger and place another needle in that, and then tie it with thread like the first one with the needle; and do not cease doing this until you have completed all the contraction of the wound."
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	"And let the needles be medium-sized between thickness and subtlety, for thin needles cut through the flesh too lightly; and thick ones are difficult to insert into the cord, therefore it is necessary that they be medium in thickness and subtlety."
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	"And it is not necessary that the needle be fixed too much in both ends of the cord, so that the flesh is not cut lightly and the wound closes before its consolidation."
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	"And do not make stitches too long lest the wound be hindered from healing."
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	"And also cut the ends of the needles so that they do not bother the patient during his sleep; and you will place over the stitches powder spread out from every part, which will hold the ends of the needles; and leave those until you know that the wound has already healed."
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	"And this kind of stitching with needles in whatever way is more suitable for small wounds, because it suffices to use one needle or two or around those."
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	"But the second stitching is like this: it is that you administer with stitching the four ends, of the cord and both ends of the ciphac, at once, with a needle in which there is thread wrapped around it in subtlety and thickness."
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	"And then when with the needle you have penetrated these four ends, reduce the needle from that same part from which you began, so that the thread draws back from the uppermost part of the wound to the lower part, so that the stitching is like stitching cloth in which the cloths are stretched."
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	"And place between each stitch the thickness of a little finger."
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	"And this stitching is known to men."
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	"And with such stitching I closed a wound that had happened to a man in his belly, which had been caused by a knife, and the disruption of the wound was more than a palm, and it extended from the bowels around two palms of the bowel of the middle place, and the disruption was in the middle of the member; and then I reduced it after twenty-four hours since the bowel had been forced out by the wound."
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	"And the wound was healed in the space of fifteen days or so, and he was cured; and this lived for many years, and is still conversing in his dispositions."
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	"And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle it was, for I did not cure him with ointment, because it was in a place where no ointment nor any medicine could be applied, but I placed cotton on the wound twice a day and washed it assiduously with honey water until it was healed."
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	"But I will tell two kinds of stitching proper according to the narration of the Word."
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	"And it is that you begin with stitching the cord, and then enter the needle from the outer part to the inner part."
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	"And then with the needle penetrating into the cord and in that part where it enters, according to its length and width throughout the body, leave the end of the thread in which you have entered the needle; and make the needle penetrate from within outwards in the other end of the thread."
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	"Once you have inserted the needle, then insert it again in the same point of the skin from without to within; and let go of the extremity of the sinew that is on this side, and insert the needle into the other extremity of the within part towards without."
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	"And make your penetration such that you penetrate into the sinew at its extremity which is in the within part that everything penetrated."
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	"First start from this side and pierce with the extremity that is on the other side of the sinew, remove the needle from the cord that has been penetrated, then reinsert it into that cord and join it to the extremity of the sinew which is on the other side with this extremity of the mirror; then remove it from the cord which is from there."
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	"And do this once or twice, and do it once again inside out as you see fit according to that example."
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	"And the summary of this manner of suture is that you should use suturing with silk thread, so that you pierce the sinew once from the side of the cord's extremity and leave it for another time to complete it."
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	"But the second species of suture which Doctor Guainerio describes explicitly is that you should pierce it according to semi-circumference, as some physicians do. Thus they join each part to its corresponding part conveniently by nature; and they apply one extremity of it to another extremity and the other extremity of the mirror to another extreme, and this is done according to how you recommend."
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	"And that you leave the needle in the extremity of the mirror near the part outside, and make it penetrate into the inside of that part, leaving two extremities of the sinew; and then turn the needle around and make it penetrate from outside to inside at both extremities of the sinew."
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	"And then turn those loops around and make each loop penetrate from inside out into the outside of that part at both extremities of the mirror, except for those on the opposite side."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	"And this manner of suture is better than common light suture, and it is the suture which was previously mentioned."
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	"This is the speech of Guainerio"
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	"And some say that abdominal suture is rectified with two needles, so that you insert into each loop a thread and begin with needle insertion from the side where it should be done, making it penetrate inside to the other side according to the suture of those who sew the bowels together."
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	"And know that when the rupture is in the middle of the abdomen, then the suture of it is more difficult than in other places of the abdomen."
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	"But the judgement of treatment of plague is judged by other plagues."
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	"Which is why, when you first notice a wound with blood clots due to altered air, reduce the hernia and cover it properly, then apply healing powder."
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"If the wound has already become inflamed, then cover it with an egg membrane that you have at hand. Make sure they are fresh and clean, dry them thoroughly, and examine them carefully; apply the same treatment as for other wounds until it heals."
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	"But if you are not present, then apply this treatment immediately, as the wound begins to form blisters and scars. Change the dressing every two days, just as you have taught, until it heals, since simple wounds require no other medication in many cases."
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	"But if you fear that the wound may communicate with the main limbs, then you should soak lion's wool in high-quality olive oil or rose oil and apply it to the area between the joints and arteries."
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	"And if there is pain or putrefaction in the intestines, as often happens, then apply black stiptic powder with wine. Especially if the decay has reached the intestines and requires urgent evacuation from within the concavity."
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	"And know that wounds of the large intestine are easier to heal than those in the small intestines."
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	"And it is difficult to heal the wound that affects the "cecum," as no healing can occur if it cuts into it. This is due to its large number of veins and size, as well as its delicate nature and proximity to nerve tissue."
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	"But if the injury affects only the skin and you can reach it easily, then cut around it according to your discretion, carefully reducing the intestines."
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	"But if the wound has spread widely and appears black or livid, then apply a poultice of bran to the discolored area to draw blood from it, since there are veins and arteries in the skin."
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	"And then cut away anything that is attached to it, and tie off the two ends of the thread from which it hung before removing the wound, so that when you have eased its attraction, you can cleanse the skin and express the fluid from the wound."
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	"
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	"When rupture occurs in the intestines and is small, it may be possible for some people to recover. For example, I have seen a man who was struck on his right side by an arrow, causing a wound in his stomach that had healed over time but still had a fistula opening. He was able to manage it with medications and diet."
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	"So I advised him to cease trying to heal the wound further once it was clear that it would not be cured. Instead, he should focus on cleaning and bandaging the area so that it could consolidate."
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	"And I saw that once the wound had healed over, he suffered no further illness due to the injury in his stomach. He did not complain about any discomfort and maintained good health by eating well, drinking moderately, bathing regularly, and exercising."
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	"Some experienced practitioners have said that when a small rupture occurs in the intestines, it should be treated in this manner: take figs with large heads and place one on each side of the wound. Then wrap another fig around both sides of the wound so that its mouth is open. When it absorbs onto those sides and tightens its mouth, cut off its head, as it adheres but does not dissolve."
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	"And then place another fig near the first one, and continue this process with figs until all of the wound is covered according to its size."
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	"And then reduce and sew up the wound. Leave those attached heads inside the intestine until it has healed, without causing any harm or discomfort."
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	"And it is possible to suture the intestine with a fine thread made from the gut of an animal, as it is more like a needle. You should take the end of this gut thread and make sure it is well-scraped, then tie one end of it around the end of the intestine with a double knot. Then pass that tied end through a needle and suture the intestine back together at the site of the rupture."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	"And this method of suturing with figs is merely a matter of trust and hope."
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	"But if the wound is large and extensive, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, then suturing alone will not suffice, as it will only result in a fine scar without healing the wound completely."
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	"On treating fistulas and abscesses:"
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	"Know that all plague and boil when it empties and becomes ancient, and is made into an ulcer, and is not consolidated and gives off a bad smell at all times, then in any member it is universally called fistula, which we call azukem."
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	"According to truth, fistula is a hard, rough, white nodosity that causes no pain and has concavity like the concavity of chicken bone; therefore it is called that swollen tumor, which means chicken bone."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	"And in some people it is moist, which gives off a bad smell; but when the moisture is cut out in certain hours, it becomes firm."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	"Sometimes this moisture is thick, scant, coarse, and subtle."
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	"And I have already said before in the division, when I talked about ulcers that all ulcer that is not healed or is not on bare flesh, is so for one of these nine causes: either because of lack of blood in the body; or because of its malice; or because between it and the lips there is hard skin preventing the growth of new skin; or because it is too deep; or because that ulcer contains pus and the matter sent to it is of bad quality; or because the medicine used for healing it is unsuitable; or when corruption occurs in the region, and there is pestilence; or because of the property of the region, like at Saragossa where difficult digestion of illnesses occurs, and healing of boils is delayed by nature; or because there are bones in it, or many bones."
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	"I have already shown all those causes, and the signs of them, and the treatment of them with medicines in the division."
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	"And therefore I will tell you about the treatment of fistula which is done by operation with my hands."
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	"And you should know that fistula occurs in all the members of the body: for there are fistulas that pertain to large veins and arteries, or to nerves, or to the bladder, or to some of the ribs, or to some of the vertebrae of the back, or to some of the compound joints formed by composition like those of the hand and foot; and there are those that occur near the principal member and similar ones."
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	"And therefore those of these fistulas that are according to this manner are difficult to heal and do not receive treatment; occupation with them is hard work and ignorance."
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	"And if there is any of these fistulas whose depth does not reach those places that I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its healing, and you want to find out about it, then take a thread or an iron probe and try to feel it with it."
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	"But if the fistula is twisted, then investigate it with a lead probe, because lead with its weight and malleability is straightened out and curved along its twists."
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	"And if the fistula has many horrible openings, it will not be possible for you to determine anything about it with a probe."
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	"Then close the opening by its openings, because the humidity with which you perform the clyster will go through the other openings and come out of them."
