E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	"And therefore investigate carefully to find out in which way it is possible for you to know if here there are arteries or nerves and whether the fistula is long or short, or whether it has many openings and is located above all this with the greatest effort of your strength, with your examination, with which you examine the illness, and the discovery of pain through compression with your hand on the place, and similar signs and causes of accidents to ulcers."
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	"And when you have examined all those causes with true observation, then come to the treatment according to your judgment: and it is whether you consider now if it is an apparent fistula near or in a healthy place, long or far from joints, nerves, arteries, veins, or any of the places that I have told you about."
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Then dry the fistula according to what has been said before about its narration, and remove whatever is in that filtration and of decaying flesh, and whatever is born in the opening of the flesh or of bile and similar things, and cure it inside until it is healed."
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	"But if the fistula is of great depth and is straight, then you should insert it into the probe as much as possible, and clean it thoroughly of all its decaying flesh; and apply dressings wrapped in sharp medicines, and introduce them into the cavity of the fistula that you have pierced with iron."
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	"And do this several times inside until the sharp medicine burns away all the decay in the cavity of the fistula due to corruption."
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	"And then restore it with ointments that generate healthy flesh until it is healed."
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	"But if it does not heal with this, then cauterize it according to what we have recommended."
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	"But if the cause of the fistula is bones and you are certain of this, then investigate it and dry it according to what we have recommended, provided that you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as we have said."
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is exposed and there is corruption and blackness in it, then scrape that inside until all the corruption is removed; and cure it with something that will make it flesh again until it is healed."
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	"And if it does not heal and throws out again as it did before, then know that you have not reached the complete eradication of the corruption; and therefore expose it again and carefully do the reasoning about it and the cleaning of it with your strongest forceps, and then restore it."
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	"And therefore if it is healed, good. But if not, then know that the corruption is in the deep and distant part of the body, which has not been reached, and therefore in this case there is nothing else to do but leave it alone."
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	"And if the corrupted bone is small or if you are able to pull it out, then pull it out with fine forceps that are suitable for that."
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	"And if there are many bones, then carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and do not leave any cause with your strength."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	"But if you encounter any difficulty with the humidity and there is no fear or mistake in its incision, then cut those membranes or flesh if it is here, and free the bones."
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	"But if you are not able to expose the bones at that time, then press on the wound whatever can cover it and leave it there until that is around those bony flesh and membranes, and guard the wound so that it does not heal and so that the section that you have cut in your operation is kept open."
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	"Have them, if you fear, compress it with a cotton cloth soaked in olive oil, or cotton cloth soaked in Egyptian pitch, or in one of the green ointments, because when these membranes dry out and the bones are separated from each other, the extraction is made easier."
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	"But if it is a large bone like the thighbone or shinbone or similar ones, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then scrape that inside with sharp steel only until that blackness and corruption are exposed, and then restore the wound."
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	"But if most of it is corrupted and the corruption has reached the bone marrow, then it is necessary to close that and cut it open where the corruption has reached, and then treat it until it heals."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	"I advise you to have someone help hold that man in place so you can perform your operation."
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	"A young man of about thirty years old was brought to me complaining of pain in his groin. An examination showed that the swelling was on the inside of the lower abdomen and had extended into the scrotum, forming an abscess with a large amount of pus, which was not caused by any external injury."
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	"And thus much time passed with that abscess growing larger because of the error of some physicians. Much matter accumulated, and its treatment was delayed until a fistula formed in the skin, through which all sorts of pus and moisture from the body could flow."
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	"And then many doctors tried to treat him over a period of two years, but none of them had any knowledge or skill in this area until I was called."
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	"I saw the fistula in his groin and the abundant matter that flowed from it over a large area. His body was already greatly emaciated, and his complexion was yellowish."
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	"And then I inserted my finger into one of those fistulas and reached the bone."
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	"Examine all the openings promptly and find those that come from every part of the chamber."
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	"And then you will cut and open one of those openings where you discovered a fracture in the bone, and you will find that it is rotten, and already earthy and decayed; and a part of the chamber through which it has entered is also decayed."
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	"And then you shall close what was revealed to me about the discovered bone."
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	"And you ensured that it was not the bone but rather that decay which you cut and closed, and you had already cleared it."
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	"Indeed, the treatment of plague with medicine has been paused for a long time, and it is not yet consolidated."
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	"Indeed you investigated again and discovered on the bone secondly on the first discovery, and you found continued decay with the bone."
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	"And closed what seemed to me from that decay, and indeed you were perforated fairly the cure of it and restoration, and it is not restored."
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	"And then you discovered again on it and did not cease to incise the bone little by little particularly and persistently pursuing its restoration, but it was not restored until you incised around a palm's length of it, and that extracted with its marrow, and indeed restored it with medicines, and it is now lightly consolidated and healed."
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	"And iteration in the operation and section of it is not necessary except for the disposition of its fragility and for the scarcity of its tolerance and fear of death, for it has drowsiness at all times due to superfluity of evacuation and bad syncope."
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	"And healed is for complete healing, and nothing remains in place of hard flesh; the disposition of it in its body is good and has returned its virtue; it is converted into its dispositions and does not do anything contrary to it in movement nor harm in any cause."
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	"But if it is prominent in place of the body already troubled, then you should cut that according to this manner: and thus take linen and strengthen that at the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to extend that in his hands; and pause that linen with wool thicker than the first linen; and indeed tie that over the flesh which is next to the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh away from its sides, and uncover the flesh on the place where you want to saw so that the saw does not touch the flesh."
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	"And pause a bench or table next to the bone properly placed, for when you do this it prevents the saw from cutting the corrupted flesh."
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	"And the sawing must be done little by little on the place of corruption, for if it is in the concavity of the bone where there is decay and does not appear in its appearance to touch, then it must be sawn again."
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	"And if the bone is decayed but not prominent, then one part continues with the other, and the decay is in the middle place or at its end, then uncover the flesh from all sides; and indeed pause a bench next to it, and indeed saw that from the first part where there is decay until it is continuous with the sawing of the other part."
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	"And let the sawing be according to the place of corruption, little by little, as we have said."
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	"And if the decay is at the joint, incise that decayed joint, and saw the bone where it continues with the other part."
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	"And if from the decay there is continuity between two joints, then it is not in its ratio but ingenious."
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	"And if the decay is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; nevertheless you must inquire how the decay appears to you, and abrade that, and cleanse that according to each disposition which is possible for you, and with every ingenuity let it be rectified by you when it does not do harm to vein or nerve."
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"And know which are the incising tools and saws for incising these bones are many according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and rarity; therefore you must prepare all kinds of suitable instruments for that operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"And know that this operation implies to you about the kind of instrument which you need; for when you have great learning and long knowledge and experience in the ways of this art, and testimony of ways of illnesses, then already you had by yourself what is convenient for it among the instruments for each illness."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And here I give you forming at the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will pause with these simple ones with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experience on the others."
Forma de serra:	"Form of saw:"
Forma de autra serra:	"Another way of cutting:"
Forma de autra serra:	Another form of saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	"Another form of large saw:"
Forma de ray:	"Form of a ray:"
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	"The head of this ray is in the shape of a star-headed key, and its points are in the shape of asterisk."
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	"And it would be convenient if with that [saw] the heads of the joints could be rubbed together when they are broken or if the mouth is too wide."
Forma de razori major dels autres:	"Form of a larger razor than the others:"
Forma de razori menor:	"Form of a smaller razor:"
Forma de razori lat:	"Form of a broad-bladed razor:"
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	"A well-made saw in another form: let it be made as curved as possible and its edge sharp like iron, and its handle made of good-quality horn, well-fashioned."
Forma de lu:	"Form of a sickle:"
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	"Form of a razor with concave edge:"
Forma de razori autra subtil:	"Another form of subtle razor:"
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	"Form of another razor with curved tip:"
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	"A small form of razor resembling an arrowhead:"
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	"The form of a cutter used for cutting bones."
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	"Another smaller form of cutter:"
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	"Form of another cutter; this one resembles a saw, with its tip like a serrated edge, and it is used in many places for cutting bones."
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	"The form of a saw which is convenient for cutting through bones that have been drilled."
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	"And its tip is triangular and sharp-pointed."
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	"And it is made of Indian steel, similarly suitable for all the uses that we have mentioned concerning razors and cutters and saws."
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	"For cutting into bones and for sawing through them."
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	"Extremities decay either from an internal cause or from an external cause. If you have treated that decay with medications and the treatment does not help, sometimes the decay may spread to a nearby limb without any apparent cause. In this case, it is necessary to cut into that limb where the decay has occurred, so that the disease may be cured by cutting out that part which is causing death or harm, as this is the greater remedy for the limb."
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	"And the sign of this is that the limb becomes black where it has been burned, even if there was no fire to burn it, or the decay approaches the blackness so that putrefaction reaches throughout that limb and spreads throughout the body. Therefore, it is necessary to cut into that."
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	"And similarly, if decay is caused by the bite of some venomous creature like a scorpion or a viper or a rat or similar."
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	"If the decay or bite is at the tip of the finger, then you should cut off the finger and not give space for the decay to spread into the hand."
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	"And similarly, if it reaches the hand, then you should cut off that part of the wrist, so that decay does not spread into the forearm."
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	"If instead it reaches the arm, then you should cut off the arm at the elbow joint."
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	"If decay passes beyond that and sometimes reaches around the elbow joint, then in such a case death from the disease is inevitable. And administering any other cause for cure besides amputation at this point is merely a matter of quantity of virtue."
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	"And similarly, if decay reaches the toe of the foot, then you should cut off that toe at its joint."
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	"If it affects the heel of the foot, then you should cut off the whole foot."
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	"But if it can reach the knee, then you should cut off the leg at the joint of the knee."
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	"But if decay has already reached above the knee, then there is nothing else to be done but to let it take its course and leave the disease to its natural death."
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	"The manner of cutting off or sawing through a limb is as follows: first you should stretch the ligaments on the side where you wish to cut, and then stretch another ligament above that place. Then the assistant should extend one ligament towards the sides, and the other assistant should extend another ligament upwards. And you should separate the flesh which lies between two ligaments with a broad knife so that all the flesh is exposed. Then it may be cut or sawn through."
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	"And care must be taken to apply a bandage of linen to all parts so that the place is not touched by anything else, and so that the wound may heal properly with an appropriate scar."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	"But if bleeding occurs during the operation, then you should cauterize the place carefully, or apply some powders that will arrest the blood. Then return to your medication until it is completed."
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And afterwards bind up the limb with a bandage at its proper place, and care for it until it is healed."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	"And I will tell you what happened to one man in his foot, which I and you are discussing, namely that he suffered an accident where the blackness appeared on his foot with burning such that it resembled fire-burnt."
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	"And this decay first affected his toe so that it spread throughout the whole foot."
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	"Then that man prepared for himself puts on a plaster where the cure goes to the member with the intensity of its heat that overcomes pain and burning, and he enters that foot into the joint, and it is healed."
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	"For a long time, it happened that this plaster fell into corruption in his hands."
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	"Then it came to me, and so I was perforated by that superfluity with the water that I had placed on his hand for the medicine, near the purification of his body; and the superfluity was not contained and began to go to another finger where it began in his hand."
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	"And he told me to incise his hand, but I did not want to do that hoping for the containment of that superfluity, and more than that I feared for the incision of his hand death, because the power of illness was strong."
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	"And although he persisted with me, he returned to his land and it came to my knowledge that this man prepared and incised all of his hand, and he was healed."
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	"And I have not recorded this narrative except to serve as an aid for what may befall from this illness, and that there may be significance for which it is signified and according to which it operates."
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	"On the treatment of sinus conditions and the quality of enemas with medicines."
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	"When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess extends until it makes collection of pus, and then it bursts and perforates, and the pus comes out from it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the cord that is above it appears thus like a thin cloth, and no corruption has reached behind, and does not impress on bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula."
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	"But if the space extends within where corruption impresses on some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus."
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	"And its treatment is to incise that cord entirely as it appears, especially when it is thin and made like cloth, and you ensure that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption."
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	"But if you hope that the cord will adhere and that corruption has not yet reached behind succession, and there is secretion from the face of the cord, then treat it with an enema."
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	"And if you consider the sinus and then it is large and the arm that extends has a foul odor, then apply an enema with Egyptian medicine which is made of oil, sour wine and cinnamon powder, mixed equally in one vessel and cooked over the fire until it reaches the consistency of honey."
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	"And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and apply the enema with that to the sinus, and strengthen the opening of it, and leave the medicine in it for the duration of two hours."
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	"And then remove that with a probe; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the corruption is removed."
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	"And sometimes an enema is applied with water of ashes when this medicine is not present. And if you take the ash of grapevines, put it on the water, and then boil that and apply the enema with it until you are satisfied that the sinus is cleansed."
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	"And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then apply an enema with water and honey mixed together three times, and also apply one with wine and honey mixed, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when there is surplus of astringency and dryness in the wine."
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	"And when you do this several times and are satisfied that the sinus has been removed, then apply an enema with what causes flesh to grow in it."
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	"And if you take some diaphoretic unguent and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine, or apply the enema with other medicines and unguents that have the properties that have already been written in the treatise on unguents."
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	"And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and cannot receive the cannula of the enema, then dilate it gradually with a small iron probe, and pause in it with warm water wrapped in Egyptian unguent or basilicon unguent until it is dilated."
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	"And similarly, if the opening is wide, then gather its lips with a suture and leave in it the quantity that is between the enema without addition."
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	"And if the opening of the sinus from which the arm emerges is elevated above the parts above it, then close that in the pus below its place so that the arm may run down easily, because when the arm is compressed by the narrowness of the sinus, flesh can be generated there."
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	"And if it is not possible to close the sinus in the pus below according to what you wish, then prepare the member with preparation so that the arm may run out of it lightly as it appears to you and that there is no cause of the arm retained in it."
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	"And take consolidating medicines that are applied over the sinus conveniently according to what you wish, and extend them over a cloth of lint."
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	"And let the cloth be of such a size that it covers all the sinus; and then incise with forceps on the right side of the opening of the sinus a path somewhat wider than the opening of the sinus, and extend over another cloth of lint the lion medicines according to the quantity of the path, and apply it over that at a distance from the opening of the sinus so that the exit of the arm from it may be alleviated and not disturb the cloth too much, but only for a few days once."
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	"Remove that which is over the opening of the sinus, which removes it at all hours so that it does not hinder what is adjusted in it regarding the arm."
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	"And so that you may know if what runs out from the sinus of the arm is much or little, whether it is digested or undigested:"
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	"And with this consider also the place of that sinus, if the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is in the apostema."
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	"And when your treatment has lasted in this manner and you see that the matter which is cast upon the opening of the sinus is already adhering or begins to adhere, then remove it on the third day, and when you remove it, then change the cloth for another and renew the unguent."
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	"But if the sinus already has some subtle virus, then do not despair of its adhesion, because its healing is approaching, for there are some people in whom the generation of flesh takes a long time in their wounds, and among those there are also those in whom it happens conversely."
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	"And if the arm is undigested from the sinus for many days, then know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then adjust drying medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and virtue, they become dry like lion unguent when there is an excess of addition of zein."
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	"And the last thing with which it is treated is that you take lion unguent and dissolve it in rose oil, and put old, thick wine into its substance, and then apply it over there, and use it."
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	"And it seems to me in that action, when there is no arm, to use lion unguent with honey when it is cooked until it is thickened, and apply it; or you may take myrrh and aloe and incense, grind all of them together and powder over the honey when it is on the fire, and then spread that over a cloth and apply it over the sinus; and also spread that with the honey which you have cooked until it is thickened, and powder over a cloth and apply it."
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	"And sometimes, a long-winded discussion and cutting of celestial lilies (and these are celestial lilies) along with acorn flour and centaurea is administered, and use is made of those simples or adjusted ones, crushed them and sifted them and powdered over the honey that has been recommended; and thus it is done."
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	"And if the pain continues and is not cured by this treatment, you will know that the corruption is in the head of it, and then make inquiry into the bones or other hard members or membranes. Then you treat it with a fistulous cure, as was said above."
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	"For the treatment of blisters, crushed onion and adding garlic juice and cutting the finger."
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Wart is an aposteme that appears under the nail of the big toe of the hand or foot, and often appears on other toes as well. When it becomes prolonged and its cure is less desired, it is called a cauterized aposteme, or it is corrupted and emits a fluid that corrodes the root of the nail, often corrupting the entire nail. And sometimes this corruption reaches the bone, which then has a foul odor, making the tip of the toe red and the color dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so, when you have that which we have spoken of in the division and your cure does not take effect, then it is necessary for you to incise around all the superfluity that remains from the nail and properly cauterize the wound around it, for cautery is very helpful in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, but the corners of the nail begin to press on the flesh inside, causing pain and discomfort, then it is necessary for you to make a small incision at the angle of the nail that is pressing on the flesh, and gently lift up that edge and cut away the excess flesh with ease. Then apply medications that are corrosive and burn away all that remains of the excess flesh. And properly dress the wound with ointment until it heals.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then it is necessary for you to cut into the bone and remove it, for there is no time when the bone can be healed once it is corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption have reached the finger, then you should cut into it on one of the joints according to its memory, and properly dress the wound until it heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail has suffered percussion or attrition and there is severe pain in that area, then at first you should gently bleed the affected part. Then carefully cut across the nail from top to bottom with a sharp spatha, taking care not to let the cut reach the flesh beneath the nail, for this would cause severe pain and result in the birth of excess flesh in that location. And then dress the wound with something that will relieve pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	A finger that is well-formed, the flesh of which is thick and fleshy, and the bone of which is strong and hard, or a nail that is hard and tough.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some are born at the root of the joint, or else their birthplace is in some of the joints of these fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	"Yet he who was born in certain joints of the finger does not suffer pain, but he who is born in strong joints suffers greatly."
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	"And among those that are born flesh-colored, the section is light, and you should incise it with a broad blade."
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	"But of that which is born in the joint's root, cure is difficult; therefore guard against its incision."
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But in that which is born in those fingers, it is necessary to incise at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then saw with one of those suitable saws for that purpose, and then cure it so that it may heal."
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	"But consolidation which occurs in these between their jointed bones or by the birth of man that is born so, or by consolidation of phlegm or combustion of fire, or by similarity, then it is necessary to cut away that consolidation until the said joints return to their natural form."
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	"And then pause between their membranes of the lungs with rose oil infused so that they may not become consolidated lightly, and separate them one from another, or place a thin plate of lead between them so that it may be consolidated as necessary."
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	"And similarly if consolidation occurs in some of these with the palm, then cut away that consolidation according to how it is prepared and convenient for the figure of the member."
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	"Of incision of veins, there are many ways."
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	"Veins are many and there are large veins wrapped around thickly filled with superfluous black bile which come out in the joints of the limbs of the body, and their greatest abundance is in the thighs, especially in those of travelers, laborers, and porters."
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	"Therefore it is necessary to administer purgation of the body from black bile several times with strong evacuation, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein."
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	"But the cure of them with iron is according to two ways: one way is that it should be incised and that black blood should be drawn out, and another way is that the vein should be raised up and all should be extracted."
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	"The section of the leg is according to this way: first anoint the beginning of the thigh with cold water much so that thick blood may be resolved, which is sediment of the thigh, and then bind the thigh of the sick from the upper part of the hipbone down to the lower part of the groin with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place or two or three with broad section, and then raise out black blood with a sponge from below the part above the thigh into it up and down so that as much blood as you wish may be taken away and that times may suffice, and which may tolerate the virtue of the sick."
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	"And then bind it up and command him to abstain from foods generating black bile."
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	"And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when veins are full and as much as is necessary for the sick person."
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	"But the elevation of them is according to this way: you who raise up the thigh of the sick one, if there are knots on it, and then place him in bath and anoint his thigh with cold water until it reddens and veins become prominent; or have him exercised by strong exercise, if bath is not present, until the member becomes hot."
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	"And then cut the cord in the right of the vein by section in the long or last of it you should do to the groin, or in the upper part of it you should do to the heel."
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	"And then tie up the cord with forceps and strip the vein from all sides until it appears to the touch, and it should be the appearance of him who often that vein asks declining towards blackness."
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	"And then when you evacuate, tie up the cord again with white wax which should be hard."
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	"And then place below that part until it is elevated and thrown off from the cord, and suspend it with anointed wool or lint."
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	"And then cut another section close to that section by three fingers, and then strip the cord from the part above the vein until it appears."
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	"And then elevate that and cut it in last section towards the heel, and then extract that and elevate that until it is taken away by second section, and then extract that from the section which is above it."
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	"And do thus until you extract that from the section which is above or beyond all sections, until all is taken away; and then cut it."
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	"And if you do not obey to extract and elevate, then insert a strong double-threaded needle and ligate that and extract it, or insert below the part and turn your hand around until it is thrown out."
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	"And be careful that it is not cut; because if it is broken, it will be difficult for you to elevate much and harm will come upon the sick one by that."
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And when all is completely thrown out, then place on the place of the wound with wool moistened in rose oil and unroasted oil and oil roasted, and cure it until it is healed."
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	"And if the vein is contracted having no tortuosity at which there may be encirclement to parts, and not being according to rectitude as we have said, then you should cut over that through all part of tortuosity of it and in places of encirclement of it, and then suspend it with forceps until you elevate that completely."
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	"And be careful to make your section so as not to cut the vein and not to wound that because it will be difficult for you to elevate much; and use your wisdom in this."
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	**Form of the incident with which vein is cut:**
Forma de unci orp:	"Shape of an ointment horn:"
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	"It is not sharp like needles and it does not have a pointed tip so that it doesn't harm the vein. It is thick but flexible, because if it were thin it would pierce the vein due to its thinness. As we have said, it has an excess of thickness."
De extraccio venae cruris.	"For removal of varicose veins."
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	"This vein originates in the legs, both on the land of Arabs and in the lands of India where it is hard and dry with little tenderness, where there is neither grass nor shrubbery."
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	"And likewise, it also arises from other parts of the body besides the legs."
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	"And its formation comes from putrefaction which arises from the spine, just as venom inside the body produces snakes, worms, crabs and worms generated between the spine and the flesh."
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	"And a sign of the onset of this condition is when there occurs inflammation in the leg that becomes swollen and red, from which the vein starts to emerge like a plant root."
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	"And when it appears at the end of this condition, then you should wrap around that one pound weight of lead which is the weight of two dragons; and tie it there, leaving the lead suspended from the leg."
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	"And whenever you notice that some part has moved outward due to this condition, then wrap it in lead and tie it there."
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	"If it is prolonged, then you should cut off one part of it and wrap the remaining portion; but do not cut so deeply that it remains inside, for if you do this it will contract and enter into the flesh causing inflammation, putrefaction and a bad ulcer in that spot."
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	"Therefore it must be treated gradually and extracted little by little until all of it has been removed from the body, so that none of this condition remains inside."
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	"And there are some men in whom this vein is as long as two hands and ten fingers, and I have heard that one man had it up to twenty hands."
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	"And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert a probe into the channel and pierce it with a long probe through the body until everything that is in it has been evacuated. Then apply putrefying medicines to this area for several days, and also treat it according to the cure for apostemes."
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	"And sometimes this vein has many branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot itself, and it comes out with many openings, each branch having its own opening."
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	"And therefore treat it as we have said in the division above, using the methods that have been described previously."
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	"Regarding cutting for worms generated under the skin, which is called bovine ailment."
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	"This ailment is called 'malautia bovina' in some lands because it often happens to oxen and it is a worm that is born between the spine and the flesh, it spreads throughout the body going up and down, causing the limbs to become paralyzed one by one until it breaks the spine and comes out."
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	"And its generation occurs through putrefaction of certain humors, just like what happens with worms, serpents, earthworms and ascarids in the belly."
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	"And it is feared because of its malice, for when it goes into the body and rises up to the head, reaching the brain, then it violently enters there and destroys it, causing many deaths."
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	"And therefore when you want to cure it and extract it, first find out its movement and appearance by sensation. Then grasp what is above it and what is below it with bandages and tight ligatures, dry the area above it, and extract it."
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if it is embedded in the flesh and cannot be grasped, then apply a hot cautery to the area where it dwells until it dies. The main cause that is feared is corruption of the area, as we have said."
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	"If you want to treat someone who has reached the brain near the head, then grasp above the eyebrow with a tight bandage and dry it off. Then extract it; and the patient must undergo purgation of their body using medicines that evacuate bad humors, and they should avoid foods that cause putrefaction."
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	"Regarding cutting for the ailment called nafir."
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	"This ailment is called 'nafir' in our land and it is a pain that appears in some limbs and also changes from limb to limb."
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	"And you have already seen it described as I will tell you."
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	"I was called to see a woman who was ill in a certain village. When I uncovered her arm, I saw a small inflammation on the vein of the elbow joint. After about an hour, I saw that inflammation move like a worm crawling towards me, but more slowly than it should be, as if it were alive silver flowing from place to place."
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	"And then the pain moved to that area and fixed itself in the muscle for about an hour."
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	"And then it ran through the other arm until it reached the other elbow joint."
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	"And she told me that she felt it moving throughout her body as I saw it. She was amazed by the way it moved and its speed from limb to limb."
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	"And I had already seen something similar in my patients before that time, although I have not seen many cases where the pain moved from limb to limb."
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	"But I did not see it happen like this in other patients as it happened with this woman."
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	"But I thought that this was because the woman was elderly, with dry skin and visible veins, which is why we could feel that moving wind."
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	"It is necessary that it does not appear according to this description in those who are delicate and have moist skin with hidden veins."
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	"And when you want to treat it and the patient feels that pain, if it is not apparent on the skin as we have said, then grasp over that area gently and dry it off until that constrained wind has come out. Then cauterize the area."
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	"But if you cannot feel it with your hands in that way, then treat it by purging the body and using whatever expels wind. Also use pills made from foul-smelling plants and those containing saffron and similar substances."
De extraccio de sagetas.	"Regarding the extraction of arrows."
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	"Arrows are diverse according to their species and the parts of the body where they strike. Their diversity is such that some have large points, others small, concave or blunt ones. Some are solid, while others have three edges, tongues, or barbs."
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	"And those that strike limbs or major parts of the body are of two types: some strike vital organs such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, intestines, and bladder. In these cases, if it appears to you that death will ensue, which I will describe later, then it is necessary to avoid extracting that arrow in those instances where death may occur more quickly. But if you do not see any of those signs of death, and the arrow is not deeply embedded within the limb, then extract it and treat the wound."
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	"And the signs of a wound to the brain are when an arrow strikes it and passes through the bone, causing shock, darkness before the eyes, dizziness, redness in the face, inflammation of the tongue, spasms and confusion of the mind, vomiting of bile, difficulty speaking or loss of speech, and there is white fluid resembling dust issuing from the wound, with the surrounding area appearing wet like flesh."
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	"And therefore if you see these signs, then abstain from treating and extracting the arrow, unless it is superficial."
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	"The signs of the arrow when it enters the heart are such that it is near the left nipple, and it feels as if something hard has been placed there, not a hollow cause. And strong and sudden movement of the arrow is like the movement of the pulse, and flow of black bloody plasma, and that chill in the extremities, sweat, faintness; thus you would know that death descends suddenly without warning."
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	"And the signs when the arrow has pierced the lung are: frothy bloody spittle from the mouth, and vessels near the neck become congested, and the color of the invalid is changed, and they expire with a great sigh or gasp for breath."
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	"And if the arrow pierces the pleura which is in the chest, there will be pain near the little ribs at once, and a great difficulty of breathing with violent pain and sighing, and all the members are paralyzed."
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	"And if the arrow pierces the stomach, immediately there is a strong flow of undigested food from the mouth."
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	"And if the arrow pierces the belly and is stuck there, some wound or tear of the flesh or bowel, which has been broken, will occur, and there is little hope for recovery from this, even if the arrow were extracted."
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	"And if the arrow pierces the bladder, urine flows out immediately, and there follows inflammation of the surrounding parts, and strong pain is felt at once, so that you will know it to be a fatal wound."
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	"But the other limbs such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, arms, and ribs, spine, collarbone, and hip bone, and their likeness of members are saved according to the best conditions when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not poisonous."
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	"And I will tell you what I have seen concerning these arrows, so that you may know how to treat them."
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	"That is why, in the case of a man who was pierced by an arrow in the lachrymal bone of his eye socket near the root of his nose, I extracted it from the other side leaving behind the gristle of his ear, and he recovered without any injury to his eye."
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	"And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which had struck him in the gristle of his eyelid, leaving behind the eyelid itself and the arrow was already hidden, and it was not possible to seize hold of it except for a little point by which it adhered to its shaft, and it was one of those sharp arrows of the Turks with a lion's head on which there were no feathers."
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	"And the Jew recovered, without any harm to his eye."
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	"And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which had fallen into his throat; it was an Arabian arrow with feathers on it. And then I made an incision over that between two guides and it was already submerged in the throat. Then I carefully extracted it with forceps and pulled it out, and the Christian recovered."
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	"And I extracted another arrow from a man who had been pierced in his belly and thought that he would die from it. And after thirty days had passed with no change in his condition due to his natural disposition, I made an incision over the arrow and extracted it, and he recovered without any harm."
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	"And I saw another man in whom an arrow had struck his back and the wound had healed over it. And after seven years had passed, the arrow emerged at the root of his hip."
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	"And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had struck her belly and the wound had healed inside her without any change in her condition. And the woman did not suffer any harm in any of her natural functions."
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	"And I saw another man in whom an arrow had struck his face and the wound had healed over it, and then the arrow broke off without causing much pain, resembling these ones."
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	"And I extracted the arrow from the face of one of the king's princes which had struck him in the middle of his nose and was already inclined slightly to the right side. The whole arrow was hidden."
