E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	"And I was called for his treatment as soon as three days had passed after he was struck by the arrow."
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	"And then I drew out the arrow very straightly; and then I explored it with a subtle tent, but did not find it; yet he felt a prick coming from behind his right ear, and then hoped that this prick was because of the tip of the arrow."
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	"I plastered the place with plaster in which the attracting and digestive virtue was found, believing that this place would be suitable for it to appear to me where the arrowhead was, so that it could dry over it."
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	"And it did not happen that the arrow had reached that spot by chance; and I continued applying the plaster there for many days, but no accident happened; and the wound had healed in the meantime, and the illness from the injury of that place disappeared over the course of many days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and recognized it as such."
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	"And then I applied medicine that was corrosive and sharp to the wound for many days until it opened up, and with a probe I felt around that place, and grasped the tip of the arrow subtly, which adhered to the shaft."
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	"And thus I continued applying that sharp medicine to the opening of the wound until the tip of the arrow appeared visibly to me, and I spent four months with that for the duration of time."
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	"And then when the wound had become enlarged, and it was possible for me to insert the forceps into it, I seized that with them, but I could not remove it immediately, so then I did not cease subtly manipulating and inventing ways of doing so until one day I began to do so with a device made by hand, which will be described at the end of this chapter, with which I extracted it; and thus I restored that wound."
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	"And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose cannot be restored, but I restored it and the wound was consolidated, and the illness was healed entirely, and there remained nothing in it on any account."
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	"And I recount to you the method of extracting certain arrows because it is appropriate and significant that which I have not mentioned, for the parts of this art and the definitions of that are not understood with narration nor comprehended by this book."
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	"And the learned artist compares little about much; and what is present with what is absent, and he finds new operation and new instrument in the descent of foreign causes of the art when it happens."
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	"And therefore I say that arrows are not ejected from the members into which they are inserted, except in two ways: either by attraction of the place where it intersects, or by the contrary part."
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	"And that which is ejected by the place where it enters, it is an arrow proceeding in a fleshy place and is drawn out."
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	"And if it does not obey extraction at the moment that you catch it, then you should leave it for a few days until the flesh around it softens and its attraction and exit are alleviated."
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	"Similarly, if it is inserted in bone and does not obey extraction, then leave it for a few days and repeat that with attraction and motion each day, and it will be ejected."
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	"And if it does not obey extraction even after a few days, then you should pierce around the arrow in that bone on all sides with a subtle drill until the place is enlarged by the arrow, and thus extract it."
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	"And if the arrow is inserted in the skull bone and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of those accidents which I have mentioned appear in the illness, then abstain from extraction of the arrow and leave it until its being is equated after a few days; for if the arrow reaches the pharynx, then death will not be prolonged."
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	"And if the arrow is inserted only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the pharynx, and the illness remains for a few days without any cause of those accidents occurring, then you should devise the attraction of the arrow and its exit."
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	"But if it is deeply inserted and does not obey extraction, then you should apply drills around the arrow as we have described, and thus cure the place until it is healed."
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	"But if the arrow is deeply hidden in the place of the body and is hidden from sensation, then you should search for it with your finger; and if you feel it, then attract it with some instruments that are convenient for its attraction."
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	"And if you cannot reach it because of the narrowing of the wound and the length of the penis, and there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein here, then incise on the wound until it is enlarged enough for it to be possible to extract the arrow."
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	"And if it is held by the ears with which it is gripped, then release the flesh in which it is inserted on all sides with whatever art you can devise; and devise about this: if you cannot succeed through evacuation of the flesh in fracture of the ears or torsion of them until it obeys."
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	"And when you perform extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then use torsion of your hand with forceps on all sides until it makes that obey; and be subtle with extreme subtlety so that the arrow is not broken and is made easy for its difficult attraction and extraction."
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	"And if you cannot succeed with that at your moment, then leave it for a few days until the parts around it have softened, and thus repeat it; for now it will be alleviated."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	"But if you experience contrary flow of blood, then perform what we have said about cure in its chapter."
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	"And guard your virtue of incision of vein or nerve or cord, and devise in every possible way for evacuation of the arrow with facility, tranquility, slowness, and steadfastness as I have recommended to you."
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	"And then cause the arrow to contract in such a way that the illness follows the figure according to which the case of the arrow was made for it; for this is more beneficial."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	"But if that is not possible for you, then perform what is possible for you according to the figures."
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	"But the arrows that are ejected by the contrary of another party, or from which some part has already proceeded into its outer parts, or cause swelling in the extremity of the arrow through sensation of the flesh above the wound and thus enlarge it; then cut over it; and let the section be according to the quantity taken by the forceps; and thus extract it, for it is made light for extraction."
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	"But if it is retained in the bone, then twist your hand in contrary direction until the arrow impresses on the bone, and thus amplify its entrance, and thus extract it."
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	"And otherwise, leave it for a few days, and thus repeat it until it is extracted."
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	"And if the shaft of the arrow is in that, then push it out with it."
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	"But if the shaft is broken and you wish to perform pulsation, then introduce it and that if it is hard; use a concave instrument so that it enters between the concavity of it and the end of the arrow, and thus push it out with it."
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	"But if the arrow is concave, then push it out with a strong instrument entering into that, for the arrow is alleviated by that."
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	"And if the arrow is poisoned, then it is necessary that you incise all the flesh around where the wound is, if this is possible for you; and thus cure it with what is appropriate."
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"If the arrow strikes the foot, belly, bladder, or side, and is close enough for you to touch it with your hand, and if it's possible for you to cut around it, then do so carefully, avoiding veins or nerves. Extract the arrow, and cover the wound with a poultice if necessary. Care for the patient until they are healed."
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	"Forceps-shaped instrument used to extract arrows:"
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	"The ends of these are shaped like bird's beaks, which become serrated when they grip the arrow so that it is not released."
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	"And among these there are many types: large, small, few, and medium-sized ones, according to the quantity of the arrow's size and its thickness, and the width of the wound and the tightness of the flesh."
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	"A concave form of this extremity shaped like a bird's feather is used to facilitate the insertion of the arrowhead into the flesh and to push it out."
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	"Form for pushing with the blunt end:"
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	"Like this: <diagram> so that it may facilitate the entry of the flesh into the arrow's concave cavity and be pushed in with it."
De fleubotomia de las venas.	"Regarding venesection (flebotomia):"
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	"The veins usually opened during phlebotomy are: sixteen in the head, two pulsating veins near the ears, called temples; two veins apparent on both temples; two veins located at the corner of both eyes, called lacrimal veins; one vein prepared at the middle of the forehead and one at the tip of the nose; two veins at the neck; two veins at the upper lip; two veins at the lower lip; and finally, two veins behind the tongue."
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	"The veins opened during phlebotomy in the arms are five: one is the cephalic vein which runs over the wild side (lateral side); it's called 'the head vein' and it's deaf; it's also a median vein composed of a branch from the basilica and another from the cephalic vein, which people call 'the vein of the whole body'; the basilica is the vein situated on the domestic (medial) side, known as 'cubital' or 'elbow vein' in common language; the funis of the arm runs over the elbow and is where phlebotomy takes place; it appears visibly on the wrist; the salvatella is the vein located between the auricular bone and the little finger's metacarpal, which divides into two branches."
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	"And in the thigh and leg there are three veins: one of them is located at the curvature of the kneecap on the lateral side (outside); the second is called saphenous, located near the bend of the inner thigh (medial side); and the third is the sciatic vein, located behind the outer thigh (lateral side). In the leg there are other veins similar to those mentioned."
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	"The benefit of opening veins near the ears is for ancient catarrhs, migraines, headaches and ulcers on old wounds."
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	"And the procedure for opening those veins is as follows: the patient should be lying down with their head tilted towards the occiput (back of the head) in a comfortable position. Then, wrap a cloth around the patient's head, making sure to cover both veins near the ears and the location between them on the forehead. Tighten the cloth gently but firmly, then feel for the pulse of the veins with your index finger. When you've found it, make the incision."
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	"Then, take the lancet, which is used for incising. Insert it into the vein in the elbow until blood flows out."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	"And elevate your hand with the vein and elbow upwards, then make an incision into the vein using an incising cut."
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	"And make the length of the incision equal to two fingers' width or about that amount, then let as much blood flow out as desired."
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And afterwards apply powder and dress the wound until it heals."
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	"And as mentioned at the beginning of this book, these veins are also opened with cauterization."
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	"Among the two arterial veins on the temples, the benefit of phlebotomy is for ancient migraines, chronic bad humor, habitual inflammation of the eyes, and acute attacks of superfluous heat in the cheeks."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	"And the procedure for phlebotomy of those veins is as follows: Have the patient lean their head forward until both veins appear clearly. Then feel for the pulse of the veins with your index finger, and once you've found it, make the incision."
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	"And elevate the elbow above the vein with your index finger. Insert the phlebotomy lancet into it, raise the vein up, and make an incision just as you did for the other two veins. Then let blood flow out according to your needs."
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And then untie the bandage from the patient's arm. Place your index finger on the vein for about an hour, then press a cotton cloth and powder onto the wound with strong pressure. Leave it like that until it heals."
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	"And as previously mentioned at the beginning of this book, these veins have been remembered and their incisions and attractions are described."
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	"And the benefit of phlebotomy from the frontal vein is similar to that of the cephalic vein for ancient diseases of the face, migraines, nosebleeds, and fetid ulcers."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the procedure for phlebotomy of that vein is as follows: Have the patient lean their head forward with a bandage wrapped around it so that the vein appears. Then take the instrument called 'fossor' which has this shape:"
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Place the pointed tip of the 'fossor' onto that vein and strike it with a pen or other tool in this manner, then let blood flow out according to your desired amount. Then unwind the perforation from the patient and apply pressure until it heals."
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	"Sometimes it is useful to perform phlebotomy laterally. However, the phlebotomy should not have an acute tip like others, but rather a blunt one on one side. Perform the phlebotomy transversely because if it's sharp and fine, it might break the bone in that area during phlebotomy."
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	"The benefit of the two veins that are on the temples is for the itching of the eyebrows due to redness and heat in the eyes, and for diseases of the face."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	"And the procedure for phlebotomy is as follows: Have the patient lean their head forward with a bandage. Then perform phlebotomy on those veins while you are standing above the patient's head."
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	"And perform the phlebotomy transversely with a blunt lancet that's not too sharp, because there isn't much flesh in that area. If the lancet is too fine and sharp, it might break."
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And then let blood flow out as much as you need. Press cotton onto the wounds and apply pressure overnight. Then untie it in the morning."
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	"The phlebotomy of the vein in the nose is beneficial for acute fever and violent inflammation, and for diseases of the face, migraines, nosebleeds, especially if they are chronic."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	"And the procedure for phlebotomy of that vein is as follows: Have the patient lean their head back and place your left hand on their nose. Then take a sharp lancet and insert it into the middle of the tip of the nose vertically, because the vein does not appear here to the touch, and blood will begin to flow immediately."
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	"It is important that you gradually withdraw your hand with the lancet and let blood flow out according to your needs. Then leave it for the night because this wound heals easily."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	"The benefit of phlebotomy from the two veins at the wrists is for constriction of the uvula, the beginning of leprosy, and many other diseases such as impetigo and destructive corrosive ulcers like herpes zoster."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	"And the procedure for phlebotomy of those veins is as follows: Have each patient lean their head forward with their arm outstretched. Then stand above the patient's head and have them sit on a stool."
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	"And then perform phlebotomy on the vein along the arm with a blunt lancet little by little. Then extract blood according to a moderate quantity or as much as is necessary at that time, and do the same for the other vein."
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	"And then untie the bandage and compress the two veins with a midrib binder for a while to ensure that the patient is not faint. Then leave it overnight because the wound will be healed by morning."
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	"For the benefit of bloodletting from the large veins, it relieves small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, corruption of the gums, and bad ulcers and fissures, as well as bad ulcers that are found in the nose and around it."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	"And the quality of bloodletting from those veins is that you first hold the patient's head steady with one hand, and then wrap a cloth around their neck to protect it. Then carefully pull back the lips and observe where both veins are located, one on the right side of the lip and the other on the left. The demonstration of each vein is indicated by its darkness compared to the other, and there are more small dark veins in that area. Then cut each one with a single cut."
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	"But if there is doubt about which vein it is, and you are unsure of its location, then make the incision on the larger one, and follow the course of that vein."
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	"And imitate the appearance of both veins that are in the lips above."
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	"But it is customary to cut both veins that are on the left lip more often."
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	"But of the two veins that are on the left side of the tongue, it is particularly appropriate for bloodletting from the cephalic vein to precede those found in the cheek, for diseases of the uvula and mouth."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	"And the quality of bloodletting from those veins is that you follow the disease along your side and toward the sun, raise the tongue gently, and look for both veins on either side of it. The color of each vein will incline towards darkness."
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	"And then bloodlet from each one; but be careful not to cut too deep in bloodletting those veins, because arteries are nearby."
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the veins that are bloodlet in the neck are those which usually run through all people. Bloodletting from them is done in two ways: either with a mirtillat or olive oil lancet for subtler cuts; or with a cutellar lancet and catgut thread, and this is how it is done:"
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	"And this catgut thread is used for sewing the incision closed. It must be special, thin and fine according to the width of the veins and the narrowness of those veins."
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	"How to perform bloodletting with a mirtillat lancet:"
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	"Be sure to sharpen the edge of it like this, and use it to open concave veins that appear full and contain dark, turbid blood."
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	"And this is how you perform bloodletting with an olive oil lancet:"
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	"And this bloodletting is of lesser width and has a more subtle point. It should be used for bloodletting from thin veins containing clear, citrus-colored blood."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	"But the main purpose of bloodletting from the basilica vein is that it removes blood from diseases on the left cheek and neck, and also from those that affect the chest and abdomen."
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	"And the phlebotomist should be careful when bloodletting from that vein and proceed with caution, because there is an artery nearby. If they err in their puncture, they may lacerate the artery and cause excessive bleeding. Therefore, it is not recommended to use a pointed lancet for this procedure, but rather one that is blunter and can be used with catgut thread."
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the basilica vein is not apparent by its usual signs, then you should leave it and move to another vein, either searching for one of its branches or bloodletting instead at the end of the arm where it is more visible. In this case, you should use a catgut thread lancet as previously mentioned."
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	"But if you wish to perform bloodletting from the median vein, then it should be done near the elbow crease of the arm where you can feel the pulse. Hold your arm down with one hand and use a catgut thread lancet to make an incision into the concave vein, as previously mentioned. Be sure not to hit the artery located nearby."
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	"And when you twist with the thread, if there is swelling where you have placed your finger, then that swelling is an indication of the artery, so avoid that area."
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	"If blood flows like a fountain during the bloodletting procedure and it is clear red in color, then you know that it is arterial blood. In this case, you should stop twisting your finger over that area for a long time. Then remove your finger, and if the bleeding stops, you should squeeze the arm gently to help close the wound."
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	"And beware of infection from the wound, and be especially careful not to aggravate it by touching it for a few days until it has healed."
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	"But if the bleeding does not stop and continues to flow freely, then you have probably severed the artery. If this is the case, do not try to treat it yourself. Instead, use a compress of fistic [fresh figs] to stop the bleeding, and then apply a poultice made from mallow leaves over the area where the vein was cut the next day."
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	"If the bleeding stops, that is good. But if not, then treat it with the remedy mentioned earlier for stopping bleeding at the site of powders."
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	"And bloodletting from this area is difficult in many cases due to the small size of the vein and the possibility of damaging the nerves of the arm."
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	"But bloodletting from the dark vein is beneficial in removing blood from the upper right side of the head and the left side of the body. This is because it is composed of branches from the basilica and cephalic veins, as previously mentioned."
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	"And the phlebotomist should be cautious when bloodletting from this vein because there is a nerve nearby. If they mistakenly cut it with the lancet, they may cause paralysis, which can be difficult to heal and may never fully recover. This nerve is often palpable but can sometimes be hidden beneath the skin in some people. In such cases where it cannot be felt, one should use a blunt-tipped lancet for bloodletting and avoid damaging the nerve with excessive pressure."
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	"And if the vein is located between two nerves, then you should cut across its length to avoid damaging either of them."
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	"The benefit of bloodletting from the cephalic vein is that it draws off blood from the head and helps alleviate headaches."
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	"In this case specifically, if you wish to bloodlet using an olive-shaped or myrtle-shaped lancet, then do so because these shapes are safest for all veins as there is no artery or nerve nearby."
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	"But remember that you should not bloodlet too deeply with the lancet alone, but rather search for a lighter location and do not try to hit it if it is not easily palpable upon the first percussion."
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	"But in some cases, an aposteme [hematoma] may occur if one attempts to bloodlet at the first percussion without success. However, they should not try again on that aposteme."
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	"However, the quality of bloodletting from this vein and its potential complications are many, which you should carefully consider for their correction."
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	"The first thing you should know about bloodletting is that it should only be performed for the conservation of health and with the expectation of benefit and caution against potential illness. It should be done on one of the three main veins: cephalic, basilic, or median cubital vein. Bloodletting should preferably be done in springtime, after fasting in spring and autumn, and before meals in winter, when signs of plethora appear."
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	"Perform a bloodletting on the third day after it has been three hours since sunrise."
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	"And when bloodletting is administered, whether it brings convenience and necessity at that time or another, either by day or night, at any hour."
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	"And it is not appropriate to perform bloodletting on a child who has not yet reached fourteen years of age, nor should a pregnant woman be bled unless she is in her fourth month, and old people who have surpassed sixty years should not be bled."
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	"And when someone wishes to be bled for any reason whatsoever, it is necessary to cleanse their bowels beforehand with a lion's claw enema, especially if they have much retained feces, so that the veins do not draw impurities into the bloodletting of the bowels, which are purified, and thus harm the principal members."
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	"And those suffering from sacred disease and gluttony should not be bled until they have recovered from their illness or drunkenness; nor should those suffering from dropsy be bled. Bloodletting should rather be avoided during colic pain and vomiting, as well as during abdominal inflammation and multiplication of coitus, hard labor, and excessive exercise following long fasts or vigils, or any other cause that dissolves bodily strength or fluids."
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	"And consider also the refinement of humors before performing bloodletting: if the blood is thick, use foods and drinks to thin it out, and medications if necessary."
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	"And also perform a bath if nothing prohibits it, or exercise somewhat for the blood to become refined."
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And pause bloodletting on that day at sunset, except during the hour of Terce, as we have said."
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	"And ensure that the sunset of that day is guarded from all sudden accidents, such as anxiety, anger, fear, and also from all bodily accidents like excessive work, fatigue, coitus, and similar things."
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	"And at his seat let there be present the causes according to their use, with aromatics and fragrances and balms and similar things, as much as possible."
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	"And let the bloodletter lie on a couch that is higher than the couch of him who is to be bled."
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	"And also, before extracting the vein, rub his arm with his hand two or three times; and also, strengthen the limb with a bandage and wrap it twice."
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	"And let the ligature be moderate, for if it is too tight, it prevents blood flow; or if it is too loose, it causes superfluous bleeding. In either case, it prohibits proper bloodletting. But if it is moderately applied, it allows the blood to flow evenly."
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	"And also, before applying the ligature, let him who is to be bled rub his hands together for a moment until the veins are inflated and clearly felt."
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	"And also, let the bloodletter anoint his lancet with a little ancient oil properly; and also, let him place his index finger of his left hand on that vein where he wishes to perform bloodletting, so that the vein may swell slightly and the percussion be seated correctly. For it is said that among the veins there are some that resemble strings or cords, and those that are full of windiness contract under the lancet, causing the bloodletter to slip and lose his grip; and if he does not find the vein at first, then it becomes narrow."
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	"And therefore, it is necessary that the bloodletter be firm and attentive to all these causes."
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	"And also, after inserting the lancet, if the vein is not filled at once, it is good; but if not, withdraw it slightly and try again in another place nearby, or else on the surface of the skin if there is no swelling."
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	"And if the location is inflamed or the illness worsens, then let it rest for a day or two, and do not tighten the bandage too much, lest it draw out an abscess, nor enter into baths."
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	"And also, repeat the bloodletting if necessary."
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	"And if the opening is small and blood flows subtly, and you fear that not enough blood will flow out as desired, then insert the lancet again in the same vein according to its rectitude and adjust the opening slightly; but do this with haste before the location becomes inflamed, for many men become inflamed from a small opening."
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	"But if the location is already inflamed, then do not insert the lancet again there, for it will serve no purpose; instead, apply some olive oil to that part of the skin, for it alleviates blood flow."
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	"And it is better in this location than other oils."
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	"And similarly, apply olive oil in all bloodlettings where veins are opened with the prohibition of blood flow, and they do this by applying tyriaaca almonds and saggina when pausing from one of those over the location, for blood becomes thinner and is better circulated when it is thick."
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	"If a large abscess is formed at the location of bloodletting, as often happens, especially if one has not been bled for some time or if the opening of the vein was too small, then let him apply a poultice and place over the location a sponge infused in water and salt, lightly scorched; let this remain for an hour, for it will dissolve."
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	"And let him do this also at the conclusion of bleeding from that vein with completion of it or of another vein."
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	"If there remains in the location for some days any blackness or greenness, do not heed this; and if you wish, apply over that location a plaster of aloe and myrrh dissolved, or of mint juice or calendula or the like."
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	"Many times apostemes and swellings occur due to bloodletting from the basilica (vein)."
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	"And therefore place your hand over that (vein), and if you feel softness due to your compression over it, then that swelling is bad and harmful; and therefore be sure to apply over it some cause of what we have said, for blood will flow strongly from the artery."
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And make a plaster with that which has astringent properties so that the location may be endured; and also treat it with other appropriate remedies until it is healed."
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	"And it is necessary to draw blood from each person according to the quantity of his strength and according to the prevailing color over the blood as it appears."
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	"For if the blood is black, let it flow out until it becomes red; and similarly if it appears thick, let it flow out until it becomes thinned; and likewise if it is bitter, let it flow out until its bitterness is removed."
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	"And it is necessary for that person who is full and strong and has need of bloodletting in one session to amplify the bloodletting of the vein and make the lancet wide."
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	"And for that person who is frail, let the opposite be done, and it is necessary to bleed him in many sessions, and let the vein be narrow."
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	"It is better to perform a transverse section in bloodletting of veins than puncture."
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	"This manner of bloodletting saves from flow of blood and from incision of nerves; it is more laudable and safer than bloodletting according to width and length."
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	"And in that person to whom syncope is accustomed to occur during bloodletting, you should care for him before bloodletting with a little powder of millet seeds infused in wormwood wine or simple oil macerated; and draw from him blood in three or four sessions."
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	If it is a cold complexion, then perform phlebotomy to infuse an eyewash of myrrh or an aromatic eyewash scented with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and the like.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if syncope occurs after phlebotomy, and it is due to loss of much blood, then one must drink beef water and a subtle fragrant eyewash. Use aromatics with algae and rub them on the patient's body.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes mentioned in the division in the chapter on syncope due to evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And here to raise the arm and dissolve the blood according to what is seen, if phlebotomy has been done for much evacuation, and its virtue is cold, which evacuates the blood little by little, then it is according to the quantity of the virtue on consecutive days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But if one wants to raise the arm again and evacuate the blood once more, and his body is robust, then do it appropriately 7 or 9 hours after the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But if one wants to draw blood from his body contrary to the direction it inclines towards, then do it on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But in the body where much blood has already been drawn and it is hot and causes fever to occur, then draw out some blood once more and draw off a large quantity of it, amplifying the aperture so that syncope occurs. For you have conserved all the conditions of phlebotomy; and place your hand over the pulse of the body to prevent death from occurring instead of syncope, because many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not when you want to release the arm and evacuate the blood again, after the opening of the vein has already been closed and it is difficult to draw out the blood, press beneath it violently and curved, for that is very wrong.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Leave it until it is phlebotomized again; or remove that with the heat of the phlebotomy which has coagulated the blood in the opening of the vein; or place upon it some triaca ointment, or sage, and compress it with light compression until the blood is completely evacuated.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave that one alone and do not touch it until the inflammation has subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if you are provoked to evacuate blood again and there is no excuse, then do it on that same spot or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "the rope of the arm" is phlebotomized in place of the furca or basilica, when they are not visible or hidden, for it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of phlebotomy of that one is that the patient immerses his hand in cold water until the flesh reddens and the vein appears manifestly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And make sure to tie it tightly with a ligature made of twisted thread with moderate tension; and phlebotomize according to the transverse direction, not latitudinally nor according to length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the aperture be wide and your phlebotomy be such that you phlebotomize that one at the junction of the hand a little bit.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then immerse your hand in cold water again and let the blood run into the water until your need is satisfied.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, then you are excused from the immersion of your hand in cold water; and in autumn the course of blood is stopped by immersing it in cold water at that time.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And phlebotomy from this vein is safer than from all other veins because it does not have a pulsating vein nor nerves.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And phlebotomy of the little finger of the right hand corresponds to diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of phlebotomy from that one is this: you tighten the hand with a ligature or your hand, because you have placed it in cold water until the vein becomes inflamed and well demonstrated at sight; and make sure to phlebotomize it transversely; and if you miss it entirely, do not worry about it.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And be careful not to end the phlebotomy on your hand, because those ones have nerves denuded of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And make sure to immerse the hand in cold water again and let the blood run into that one because if you do not immerse it again in cold water, the blood will coagulate in the opening of the vein, and its flow is prohibited.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood has been extracted according to the amount needed, then place oil and salt on the vein so that it does not close suddenly; and do likewise in all strict vein.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But be aware that phlebotomy of the little finger of the left hand corresponds to diseases of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do likewise in the phlebotomy of that one as you have done with the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the advantage of phlebotomy from that vein is for diseases that are in the parts of the body, such as diseases of the mother, and retention of menstruation, etc. and also for ulcers of skin and old wounds, and their similar diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of phlebotomy from that one is this: the patient immerses his foot in cold water and makes friction until the veins appear well; and he places it on the junction of the foot with a belt; and the place of the vein appears clearly below the said foot, and from there are many branches distributed on the face of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And then phlebotomize the largest branch or the one that is below the heel on the side of the aggregation of it because it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you phlebotomize that one on the face of the foot, then be careful of the nerves that are below that one on the face of the foot, and pause your phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize transversely, as if you wanted to miss it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And make sure that the phlebotomy is sufficient
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the emission of blood is prohibited, then immerse the foot again in cold water and let the blood run into that one until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs in the first attempt, then repeat with the phlebotomy somewhat higher up because the place is safe; and do not fear its malignancy, but rather be careful of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And do likewise with the saphenous vein of the other foot
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And concerning the sciatic vein, its place is thus: below the heel on the side of the ankle of the left leg
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the advantage of phlebotomy from that one is for pain in the hip when it is due to hot blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of phlebotomy from that one is this: the patient enters into a bath and makes haste and tightens the skin of that one on the side of the hip above the heel above four fingers with a long thin bandage because it does not appear except by that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And then when it appears, then phlebotomize that one according to each vein that is within your ability and according to the transverse, and it is better; or miss that one by incision or cut that one by section because its place is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is found more in men than women. And if you find that one, and it does not appear to the touch, then phlebotomize some branch of it, and that is the one that appears on the back of the foot near the said ear and little finger bones.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Guard yourself against the nerves, and make the blood flow as much as you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then carefully untie the ligation and place your hand over the site of the phlebotomy wound, pressing gently to stop the bleeding. It heals easily this way.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and the quality of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventilation is done with horns, or earms (earmuffs), or wicks
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Ventilation is done in two ways: one with scarification and bloodletting, the other without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation that is done without scarification is performed in two ways: either with fire or without fire
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the twelve locations of the body where ventilation is administered with scarification and bloodletting are: behind the ears; at the crown of the head; in the middle of both halves of the neck; below the jawbone on either side of the mouth; on the two shoulder blades; over the buttocks; on the inner thighs, each about a hand's breadth above the knee.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Ventilation does not draw blood from veins but from the small capillaries scattered throughout the flesh, and therefore does not drain the virtue through them, just as blood is drawn by phlebotomy. Neither does it matter whether ventilation is done with fire or without fire in any illness caused by excess within that needs to be evacuated completely from the body
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if there is a need for ventilation due to illness or continence, administer it every hour at the beginning and end of the month, and in the middle of it as well, whenever necessary.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	This is why men who have an abundance of blood that needs to be removed by ventilation experience heaviness and headache; those with congestion and heat in their face, head, and neck; those with dizziness and darkness before the eyes, and blurry vision; those who spit blood during coughing fits; those whose laughter is excessive; those who have a metallic taste in their mouth or a coated tongue that bleeds when they spit; those who sleep excessively, and those who see visions of blood, redness, ants, plagues, and other such causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, whenever any of those causes occur, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, we command that ventilation be performed after two or three hours have passed since daybreak.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	It is helpful to ventilate the nape of the neck when there is heaviness in the head and sinking at the temples, but it is important that this be done as part of a general evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	This ventilation is performed on the same spot where phlebotomy is done on the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	It is not permitted to perform this procedure on anyone who is of robust constitution or has a cold, as it can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	Therefore, this technique should not be used on the elderly or those with hot-headed illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But if one continues to perform this technique repeatedly on the same person, it can lead to forgetfulness. Therefore, you should command the operator performing ventilation to pause slightly with his hand and the cup at each of the intervals mentioned earlier, in order to prevent the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Ventilation of the armpit is done on the spot where phlebotomy is performed on the dark vein and the basilica vein: for this reason it relieves asthma, tightness in the chest, and splitting pain in the lungs, as well as coughing and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	It is important that armpit ventilation be done with care, because if it is done too vigorously it can cause weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	Ventilation of the forehead relieves accidental headaches and inflammation of the eyes, migraines, and congestion, as well as pain in the roots of the teeth. It is performed on the spot where phlebotomy is done on the basilica vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	You should command the operator performing ventilation not to press his hand at the site of incision, lest he injure the artery and cause bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	Ventilation of the chin relieves halitosis in the mouth, gingivitis, and symptoms of oral diseases. It is performed on the spot where phlebotomy is done on the veins found on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	However, ventilation performed on the two spatulas (the sides of the neck) causes headache, which is caused by congestion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	Ventilation of the two divisions at the corners of the eyes relieves symptoms associated with phlebotomy of three veins: the basilica, dark, and cephalic veins. This is because it attracts blood from all the smaller veins in the flesh, as well as the smaller branches of the other larger veins that lead to those three veins.
