Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if extension is not prepared and the bone cannot be aligned with your hands alone, then use this tool: it is made of iron, seven or eight fingers long, and its width varies depending on the size of the wound. Therefore, it is necessary for the physician to have three or four of these tools ready, according to what is needed in the treatment of all kinds of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And once it is reduced, apply slight pressure to prevent it from being displaced during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And if there is an acute angle at its ends, cut it with the scissors near its extremities; and make sure that the upper part of the bone is thicker and the inner part is wider.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is how it looks:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And in Greek, it is called "labre volentz atelarem," which means "slight spatula."
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that the acute end may be elevated above the prominence of the bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And press it into place within a splint until the bone returns to its alignment with some reduction.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	Then strive to align the ends of the fracture with one another. If the end of the broken bone is thin and does not fit well with the tool, then insert the tool between them so that it can have some leverage.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone with all that has been recommended, then cut it with scissors in the manner that is described above. Or saw it with one of the saws, whichever way is easiest for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And remove any sharp edges or small rough spots from the remaining bone.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone has been reduced and the patient feels intense pain upon movement, you should know that the bone has not returned to its proper place. Therefore, be careful so that you do not cause further harm to the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When you have completed the reduction of the bone, then cover it with a bandage soaked in black stiptic wine. And especially if it is summer, do not apply any ointment containing oil or other grease, so that it does not cause inflammation and corruption afterwards.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And apply bandages in the final stages of the reduction of the bone. Leave the dressing uncovered so that you can insert splints and use wrapping according to the size of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be very careful not to strain the dressing at the fracture site, as many foolish doctors have done this and caused harm to their patients, resulting in death or gangrene.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if your patient's fracture is light, soft, different from other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is large or infected and you fear that one of the bad accidents mentioned earlier may occur, causing pain in the area, then do not apply bandages. Instead, use a dressing made of thick cloth and tie it on firmly to keep the wound clean.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And after one or two days have passed since the wound began to suppurate, then remove the bandage that you had placed over it with wine. And apply poultices, as is customary in our practice for treating wounds, such as teriapharmacon and similar remedies.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is your duty to remove the splints and examine the wound every morning and evening until it has healed and is firm. And the limb should be positioned in such a way that pus can flow easily from it towards its lower parts.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If many days have passed and the wound is not consolidated nor has it begun to heal, then you should know that here are signs of pus formation. Therefore, explore the wound with a probe.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those signs that are separated and removed or drawn out, if they are not separated from one another and put the limb in danger and cause pain, then persevere in incising them according to what you find possible.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if pus or gangrene occurs in the wound, which is called stomatitis, or another kind of corruption and putrefaction, then it is necessary that you treat it with one of those remedies that are described in their chapter under the heading of treatment.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding that in which my speech should be brief and you perform your task: when the thick bone is crushed, do not attempt traction or extraction of it, as many times this has caused death. Leave it there until it grows together, for it will usually unite by itself in about 20 to 30 days. And then treat the wound if you see fit, or leave it alone.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the treatment of union that occurs in the place of some fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times this condition occurs during the healing process of a fracture, especially near joints, and it is characterized by a deformity of the limb. It is strictly forbidden to move the limb from its natural position.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the deformity is recent and administer those medicines that have astringent properties such as alum, resins, and myrrh. Take some of them and mix with stiptic wine, albumen of egg white, or vinegar, then apply it on the deformity wrapped in linen cloth and secure it with good compression.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And let the bandage remain undisturbed for several days until the swelling subsides. Then remove it and repeat the application until the deformity is removed; or place over that a lead plate descended from above, as lead has the property of reducing any swelling in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the deformity has already hardened and tightened, it may be necessary to remove it carefully. To do this, first make an incision along the superior edge of the limb and then incise the superfluous skin and fat until the hardened tissue is exposed. Then carefully remove that tissue using some probes or hooks until it is completely removed; afterwards, dress the wound until it heals.
Capitol .xxi.	"The chapter twenty-one."
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	"When a fracture has healed, but the limb remains thin and does not follow its natural course."
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	"When a bone fracture has healed, but the limb remains thin and does not follow its natural course, this happens for several reasons: one of which is the abundance of solution in the ligaments and bonds, not according to what is appropriate; or due to excess tightening of the ligaments preventing nutrients from reaching the limb; or due to excessive use of ointments; or due to unnecessary movement; or due to lack of blood in the patient's body and weakness."
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	"And its treatment is to feed the patient and make their heart strong so that blood may be increased in them; and administer baths; and apply warmth, joy, and comfort upon them."
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	"And also to apply plaster around the limb, so that the plaster draws nutrient to it, or continuous application of hot water, so that the nutrient flows and returns to its natural form."
Capitol .xxii.	"Chapter XXII."
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	"On the treatment of broken bones that have healed crookedly and why surgery is not appropriate in this case."
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	"When it happens that a limb which has already healed becomes crooked and prominent at the site of the break, and this causes the limb to appear misshapen, although the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation, you should not listen to those who claim that the limb has been recently broken."
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	"But many foolish doctors and bone-setters have done this in our land, and this operation is most reprehensible and brings great fear upon those who bear its mark, which is death."
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	"But if the limpness and nodosity are recent, then they should be treated with hot water containing herbs that soften them, such as marshmallow and rosewater, and mallow, and similar ones; and a plaster made from white lead should be applied with a moistening plaster like litharge well-made; or gum tragacanth of rosewater mixed with wool grease or camphor oil, and this should be plastered upon it; or ripe figs crushed with dove's feathers, and similar to those medicines called softeners."
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	"And sometimes it is dissolved by frequent gentle friction with the most humid ones, and the member should be moved in all parts at all hours."
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	"But if the crookedness has already become hard and converted into bone and surgery is necessary, then it is appropriate to cut away what is superfluous from the prominence of that bone with subtle chisels, and to administer ease in that place with care and diligence."
Capitol .xxiii.	"Chapter XXIII."
De sermo en dislocacio.	"On discourse concerning dislocation."
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	"Dislocation is the displacement of some of the joints from their place so that they are hindered in movement and cause deformity of the limb and bring about great pain and harm."
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	"Therefore when it happens that there is dislocation somewhere, then it should be promptly reduced and not delayed in reducing, because if it is delayed the joint becomes inflamed and firm, making reduction of dislocation difficult."
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	"And therefore one should not be moved or stretched at the time of inflammation, because many times it brings about spasm and severe pain."
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	"But when it happens, then you should apply the cautery to the affected part and let it rest until the inflammation subsides; and then embrocate the limb with hot water and oil, and reduce it gently."
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	"And every limb should be treated with that remedy which brings back the memory of its place."
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	"I have already set the bones of dislocation according to what is known about fractures; I placed the upper part of the body into the lower part."
Capitol .xxiiii.	"Chapter Twenty-four."
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of dislocation treatment of the jaw on the left side
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	If both mandibles are dislocated but do not reduce on their own, there are two methods to treat the dislocation of both jaws:
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	"However, if the dislocation of the limb is minor, it often returns to its proper position on its own accord."
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	"If the dislocation is entire and complete, then it must be reduced gently, without delay."
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	"And the assistant should hold the patient's head, while the doctor inserts one finger of his right hand into the dislocation of the jaw within the patient's mouth if it is on one side; or inserts both fingers together if the dislocation is on two sides. The others present should hold the rest of the body firmly in place and command the patient to keep their jaws still and relax those muscles that cause each part to move separately. Then the doctor gently moves the jaw back into its proper position."
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	"And if the reduction of the dislocation is difficult, especially if both jaws are dislocated together, then steam should be administered with hot water and oil to facilitate gentle and easy reduction without delay."
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	"After the dislocation has been reduced and the jaws are in place, the patient's mouth should be closed gently and not forced open. Then powdered cloth with cerate should be applied to facilitate easier reduction, using melted wax and rose oil."
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	"And the patient should sleep on their back with their head supported between two pillows to prevent turning it to either side. They should not be forced to chew anything, but have liquid food until the pain has subsided and the jaws are healed, after which they may eat what they wish."
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	"And this should be administered with care to avoid any strain on the opening of the mouth during eating and drinking until the jaw is healed."
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	"And if the reduction of both jaws is difficult when they are dislocated and cannot be returned to their proper places, then frequent vomiting, fever, and constant thirst often occur, with severe abdominal pain and sometimes bloody diarrhea."
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	"And when this happens, you should know that it is a serious condition; many times the patient dies within ten days."
Capitol .xxv.	Capítulo XXV
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	**Of the reduction of dislocation of the clavicle and the extreme end of the muscle.**
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The shoulder blade is not displaced from its position due to its connection with the chest; sometimes it can be displaced outward, and this is apparent by touch.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	To restore it, the patient should lie on their back and extend their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then press tightly with your palm for a moment, as it will return to its place.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then apply plaster and powder there and bind it firmly.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	However, if the extremity that is attached to it is not displaced on any day, then it should be reduced and bandaged according to what has been said and according to your judgement.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	Then apply plaster, powder, and dressing there, and instruct the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	With this same treatment, the detached end of the muscle is also reduced.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of dislocation of the muscle
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You should know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways: one is that it is dislocated at the attachment of the tendon to the upper arm bone, another is at the attachment of the tendon to the elbow.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second way is that it is dislocated at the attachment above the muscle, and this is rare; and it is not dislocated at the attachments behind by the shoulder blade or in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and exits at the attachments below the elbow near the tendon of the biceps, especially in those individuals whose flesh is thin, it is easily dislocated; but in those with much flesh, it exits out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And sometimes it happens to some men that through a blow or fall the muscle becomes swollen with blood and clotted, and is then dislocated by that swelling.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore you should remove this [swelling] before it becomes completely hardened, and then proceed with its treatment.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is recognized when it occurs at the attachments below the elbow near the tendon of the biceps; so that you may distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the normal one, since there is a manifest difference between them. And you find on the head of the muscle a concavity towards the elbow and the tendon of the biceps feels like an egg, and the patient cannot bring his hand to his ear nor move it in any way.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated at the lower end or above, then you can immediately find a palpable swelling which is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation undergoes easy reduction when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the practitioner elevates the patient's hand towards above; and approaching from behind he places his thumbs below the tendon of the biceps of that arm, and elevates the joint with force up to its place, and then the practitioner raises the patient's hand, extends it upwards; and while doing so he should pause it below when it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return by what has been said, and especially at the beginning when the dislocation occurred many days ago, then the patient should be immersed in hot water and given a poultice that softens and lubricates like a common liniment made from althea root, fenugreek, and marshmallow leaves in water.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be propped up on his back and placed below the elbow with his arm suspended between elevation and tension, and the physician places his heel upon the sphere [of the joint], elevates the head of the muscle with force, and pulls the patient's hand so that it is not hidden at its lower attachments; and another practitioner should hold the patient's head so that it is not moved from its place, for then it quickly returns to its proper position.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, you can also reduce it in this way: have present someone who is taller than the patient and stands on that side; let him insert his muscle behind the tendon of the dislocated arm and elevate the tendon upwards while the patient is suspended in the air; then another practitioner pulls the patient's hand from its lower attachments towards his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light in weight, then it is necessary that some other cause be suspended from him in order to weigh him down, for the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is also reduced in another way: this is by placing on the ground a long stake whose head is round like that of a mortar pestle, neither too thick nor too thin. Then place the patient on top of the head of the stake with cloths beneath him; then let the patient stand along the length of the stake and extend his arm at its lower attachments towards the other side, while extending his body on the other side with force so that the joint quickly returns to its proper position.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	"If reduction proves difficult for all the reasons mentioned, then use this treatment: Take a stick whose length is that of two arms, and whose width is four fingers, and its thickness should be eased in the middle according to this form:"
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	"And similarly, a lion's skin should be laid over the patient's head so that the stick does not slip."
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	"And then the stick should be placed on top of the patient's titillic, and their hand or arm should be extended over the stick to either side, and the stick should be bound over the assistant's hands and the arm and the tip of the hand."
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	"And then place your arm on a ladder rung according to its width, and extend your hand to either side, and the other end should be suspended from the other side, for the joint will be ready soon."
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	"And when the treatment is completed according to each possible manner, then you should place a compress made of wool of equal quantity on top of the titillic; and then apply an emplaster prepared from powder of ground almonds and egg whites over the entire muscle, just as it is rolled up, and then tighten beneath the titillic with moderate tension; and the bandage should be wrapped around the emplaster, and his hand should be attached to his collar, and he should rest it for seven days without moving his hand."
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	"And the patient's food should be limited during this time while the member is recovering, for it is easier for healing to occur."
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	"And then food should be gradually increased after seven or eight days and some movement exercised; and thus if it is firm and not softened, then it is healed."
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	"But if the joint is often dislocated due to humidity that occurs there or for some other cause, then cautery should be administered in that place with three burns, as is mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery."
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	"And even if all of this is done and after seven days the bandage is removed but the joint remains loose, and the emplaster and tension are applied to it several times without effect, and he cannot raise that arm above his head, then know that the nerves of that muscle, which are at its head, have been injured or stretched or softened, and know that the joint will never be put back in its proper place."
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	"For the dislocation of that which has occurred, you should press the patella and the kneecap or the parts behind, and the reduction is made with pressure and extension using both hands until it returns."
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And then apply the other bandage to that place and cure it until it is healed."
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	"And if there is heaviness in the member that occurs during healing and slowness of its movement, then the patient should use hot baths several times until that heaviness is relieved and it returns to its original nature."
Capitol .xxvii.	"Chapter XXVII."
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	"On the treatment of dislocation of the coccyx."
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	"You should know that the joint of the coccyx is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all directions, but more so towards the front than the back. The dislocation of it is not hidden from you for you can see it clearly by looking or touching according to whatever figure it has been dislocated, and when you reduce the displaced coccyx with your hand, that is made clear to you, for the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm nor touch its own muscle."
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	"And you should know that it is necessary to reduce the dislocation immediately before an abscess appears, for if an abscess appears, reducing it is difficult and the healing will not be complete; and especially when it is in the back parts, for there is no worse species of dislocation nor greater pain, and several times death results from it."
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	"And the reduction of it, when that which is possible to reduce occurs, is that his hand should be extended with two hands and his arm spread out, and the physician's hands should be placed on the coccyx from below, and he pushes the joint back with the force of both hands together or with the heel of his palm until it returns to its place."
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	"But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then it returns thus by bending his hand with his own hand until he strikes the coccyx with the heel of his palm."
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	"And if the dislocation does not obey reduction, then apply powerful extension and great force."
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	"And let two assistants extend the arm and hold it firmly with both hands so that it is not moved during the extension."
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	"And then turn the arm in every direction, because it is wrapped up with a doubled cloth or bandage around his hand."
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	"And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, anoint it with some oil for this purpose that this may be one of those causes which help in lubricity of the joint with facility. And then push the joint back with powerful pressure until it returns."
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	"And then the reduction of it should be supported with that plaster in which there is astringency and suction with white of egg, and it should be extended with descending bandage, and his arm should be suspended from his neck, and he should rest for some days."
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	"And then let it be untied. And if the joint is formed in its proper place, then you should untie the bandage from it and leave it alone."
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	"But if you see that the joint is not strong, then repeat the plaster and bandage, and leave it for some days until it is extended. And then untie it."
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	"But if heaviness occurs during the reduction of the joint and its position is in movement, then apply moistening in baths and gentle friction and compression until it is relieved. Or let him rest upon the joint elevated, for this is a matter of fatty motion. And then let him be bound, and leave it on overnight."
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	"And then remove that and put him in a bath. And when he rises, then friction the joint with gentle friction. And then repeat over it elevated, for this is routine of fatty motion, once, twice, three times."
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	"Within the bath until it is softened."
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	"And if you wish, apply over it the hollow of a moist cow's horn scarified on its edges and press upon that. Do this several times for it is moist and reduces to its position."
Capitol .xxviii.	"Chapter XXVIII."
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	"On the treatment of dislocation of maltreatment, that is of the joint which is between the arm and the hand."
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	"Dislocation of the hand sometimes occurs and its reduction is easy, unlike other joints. But nevertheless it is necessary that there should be swiftness in the reduction of it at the time when it is dislocated before a tumor appears or something happens with an abscess."
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	"And the reduction of the dislocation of it is that you place the joint of the hand of the patient on a table and an assistant extends his hand. And the physician places his hand or palm over the prominence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its proper place."
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	"But nevertheless it is necessary to consider if the palm has already been removed from the surface of the hand. Then the patient places the back of his hand on a table for extension and reduction. And if the dislocation is anterior, then the position of the patient's hand should be internally rotated upon the table so that the hand of the physician may lie over that prominence."
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	If it does not return quickly, then press it with an embrocation that draws out the abscess and leave it. And do not repeat this unless necessary, for otherwise it will suffer and you cannot reduce the inflammation that passes through the days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But first soften the joint according to its tortuosity; and do not notify the patient of any cause, but say that your hand is softened and cannot press any cause. Then you will know that the nerves are crushed or cut, and therefore it is necessary to cauterize them near their outlet, and afterwards tell him some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when it is returned badly, then pause on the embrocation which we have recommended, and let it be laid and pressed for 5 days. And near about it should be untied and left alone, and the hand of the patient should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of the hand is difficult and it occurs to him some heaviness, then you should apply that with cold water and friction several times, until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the said (joints).
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes these are dislocated entirely out of their place.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when some finger is dislocated from those on the side of the palm or on the back of the hand, then stretch the finger and push back the dislocation with your thumbs until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the tip of the finger, and suspend that above the part where it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it can be covered with its bandage on that same day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	"And when it is night, lie down according to that narration, and do not cease loosening him during the day and exercising with movement, and lie down with him at night. And do this for several days until it becomes tight."
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	"And do likewise if it is dislocated in the stomach or hand. Lie down according to that partition and perform your first operation until it is healed."
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	"And similarly do this when it is dislocated at other joints."
Capitol .xxx.	"Chapter XXX."
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	"Of the treatment of dislocation of the vertebrae of the spine."
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	"When complete dislocation occurs in any of the vertebrae of the spine or neck, removing the displaced vertebra from its place is not a cure, for death overtakes the sick person."
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	"And this is indicated by the fact that the evacuation of the sick person's excrement is without control and he cannot retain it. Many times some members become relaxed on one side or both sides, or both arms, or one of them; or one vertebra is removed from its place, for many times removal occurs and many times the displacement to all four parts is made."
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	"Therefore that which has already been removed to the posterior parts is called sciatica (gelbozitat)."
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	"But the treatment of it is this: first consider whether sciatica occurs in childhood, for if it does, there is no cure nor healing for that."
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	"But those that occur from falling or striking or similarly to these have already been discussed by the Ancients with lengthy words, of which the majority returns with profit; but this is now abbreviated because it is too long for me and excuses itself from it due to my proximity to the intention of my exposition, with which I have explained and formed diverse instruments with which I will show this and explain that."
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	"And I say that there is neither remedy nor healing for sciatica that occurs from the front part of the foot, and similarly for those that are made on both sides."
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	"And of these only those that occur properly in the back can be cured by what I will recount."
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	"And it is that the sick person should be laid on his back with his head close to a wall, and extended outwards from him by means of soft padding so that the foot of him does not get hurt."
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	"And properly a straight stick should be placed and set on the ground at the end of the foot around his head, and another stick on the other side of his feet at the other end of the foot."
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	"And the minister should hold the stick, and not be fixed in a hole; and another minister should hold the other according to that form."
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	"And properly he should cover the head of the sick person and tie him there tightly with linen bandages and fasten them; and extend the end of the bandage to the stick that is above his head, and tie it there; and properly stretch another bandage over his hips on both sides of him, and above his knees; and properly adjust all the bandages and tie them to the other stick that is above his feet."
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	"And properly each minister should extend the bandage at the beginning of the stick and not remove the two sticks and the bandages from their places where they are set, but nevertheless not fixed as we have said."
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	"And the doctor should place his palms on the sick person's back with force so that he returns, or rather if he places one table on it and properly adjusts his feet on the table so that he returns."
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	"But if he does not return by this method, then take a table whose width or length is around three braccia and hollow out in the wall that we have said is near the sick person a place in which to fit the end of the table."
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	"And properly place the middle of the table on his back and the doctor places his feet on the other end and strongly presses so that the back is shortened and returns to its proper place."
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	"And if you wish, open it with a turn made by hand. And it is that you place yourself on the ground near the head of the sick person at the end of his foot between two sticks whose length is one braccio and at the end of his head similarly two sticks; and let the distance between each stick be one palm and already made in each stick a hole through which it turns, and let each one be firmly fixed on the ground so that they are not moved."
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	"And let there also be placed a round stick on which is the hole and it should be turned in the two holes of the two sticks."
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	"And at its end there should be a hole through which the stick is passed whose length is one palm with that which turns. And in the other two sticks there should be similar ones."
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	"And properly tighten the bandages that you have tightened on his foot at the hole that is above his head and the bandages that you have tightened on his thighs at the hole that is below his feet."
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	"And properly above each hole there should be a minister who turns the hole with his hand and the doctor presses on the back as we have said."
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	"And this is the method of turning:"
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	"And properly when the back has returned and the place is pressed, then it is necessary to place an absorbent plaster with alum of hawk and properly cotton; and properly place on the plaster a table whose width is around three digits or about that, and its length should be equal to the extent of the swelling, and on the beginning of the back."
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	"And properly tie it with the bandage we mentioned and feed the sick person a subtle diet until he is healed."
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	"And if there remains some inflammation in the place at the end of healing, then it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and cleanse with administration by table for a long time which we have recommended. And already administered in that place lead plate."
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	"And sometimes inflammation occurs at the end of the two spine bones and it is squeezed by that dislocation. And that bone already threatens such that it should not be operated on with this medicine, for strong rubbing will cause you to die."
Capitol .xxxi.	"Chapter LXXXI"
De curacio de anca dislocada.	"On the treatment of a dislocated hip."
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	"You should know that the dislocation of the hip and the dislocation of the muscle is not only a displacement, but also an injury which does not occur in other joints with small movement and concavity."
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	"The hip joint can be dislocated in four ways: it can be dislocated inward or outward, forward or backward."
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	"Most commonly, the hip joint is dislocated inwardly, and less commonly forward or backward."
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	"The sign of hip dislocation inward is that when you press the healthy thigh against the affected one, it feels longer and the kneecap seems more prominent than on the healthy side. The patient cannot bend their leg backwards and must have an incision to drain the hematoma."
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	"The sign of hip dislocation outward is that the injuries occurring in it are opposite to this one."
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	"The sign of anterior hip dislocation is that the thigh expands according to its nature but does not bend due to pain in the knee area. If forced to do so, it cannot extend forward. The urine is retained and there is a hematoma in the groin area. Treatment should be directed towards the heel."
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	"The sign of posterior hip dislocation is that the knee does not expand and cannot be bent forward. The thigh appears shorter than the other one, the groin area is softened, and treatment should be directed towards that area."
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	"However, reduction of these types of hip dislocations should be considered with caution if the dislocation is old and chronic. In such cases, one should administer traction according to the patient's condition, but this is not the only treatment option. In these cases, there is no need for forced manipulation."
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	"However, in cases of recent dislocation that fall into one of the four types, it is necessary to reduce the joint and extend the leg inward and outward. Then move the leg to the right and left until it returns to its normal position, as this alone will suffice."
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	"But if it does not return in this manner, then you must prepare a strong rope and extend the thigh as far back as possible. Alternatively, you can attach ropes to the upper part of the leg or use a sling placed over the thigh above the knee. Another assistant should extend their hand above the patient's foot so that their fingers point towards the toes. Then, grasp one end of the rope tightly with your left hand while another assistant holds the other end."
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	"And extend it either from the inside to the angle of the pubis or from behind to the buttock area."
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	"And let all of this happen in one glance, while the patient is lifted up on their own body from the earth and remains hanging."
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	"This type of extension is common to all four (limbs)."
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	"And therefore if the dislocation returns as we have said, it will be good; but otherwise, now it is necessary to speak of its proper cure."
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	"In the reduction of its own (joint), when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is inwards at the hip joint, it is necessary for the patient to lie on their side with the affected leg; and then pause the limbs above the root of the thigh at that point where the head of the thigh bone enters the socket; and then extend the limb upwards from the angle of the socket to the furthest possible part of the clavicle."
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	"And then another person should take hold of the limb firmly and press the thick part of the dislocated joint and extend it forcefully outward, because that will return it to its proper place."
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	"And this type is of easier reduction with which this limb is reduced than the other types."
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	"But if it is excused on you and does not obey the entrance with this type of reduction, then both feet of the patient should be lifted together with firm, light pressure, on both heels and both toes."
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	"And let the length of each (foot) be by the amount of four digits, and let the affected limb be extended more than the other by the amount of two fingers."
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	"And then the patient should be suspended over the head of the bed, with their back up, and let the length from the ground be by the amount of two cubits."
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	"And then command a strong youth to pull down the head of the joint, and let another youth suspend it, and the other youth pull down the joint with forceful impetus, because the articulation returns to its proper place with speed."
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	"But in the proper reduction, when there is dislocation outward at the joint, it is necessary for the patient to lie on their back according to what we have recommended in the event of stiffness; and let the limb be straightened over the affected joint properly and over its foot."
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	"And then two sticks should be placed, one at the foot of it, and the other at its head; and let two sticks be placed that are adjusted in the middle of the elbow, over which damp cloths are wrapped, so that the patient is not injured because the stick is between their joints, for the extension to the joints should not be forced."
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	"And then each assistant should extend on his own side, and the physician with his hand guide the reduction according to the art."
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	"So if it does not succeed in reverse, then pause over that diligently and thus as we have said in stiffness for that guidance."
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	"But the patient should lie on their left side quietly."
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	"When dislocation is at the front parts, then it is necessary that the bed be extended lightly, and this is according to this method; and the doctor places the palm of their right hand on the sick person's flank, and then grips that with the other hand, and with that grip extends the legs away from the leg of the pain."
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	"If the dislocation is at the back parts, then it is not necessary that the sick person be extended with the legs away from them, and they are raised off the ground; it is necessary that they be placed on a hard surface, like this: if the hip joint is dislocated externally, according to what we have said about placing it on two widths; and they lie on their face and the limbs are extended, as we have said."
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	"It is necessary that compression be administered with a board over the location where the joint is dislocated."
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	"So when the reduction is completed as it should be - and the sign of the reduction of the hip is not hidden from you, which is that you extend the sick person's two thighs, and when you feel those joints and the sick person extends their thigh and expands that without excuse, then you know that the member has been returned to its proper place; then you apply two splints and bind it tightly with a bandage so that the joint is not moved in any of the parts; and let the sick person rest for three days or four."
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	"And after removing the ligature and splint, compare one thigh with the other."
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	"Then if you feel those joints firmly, then you know that the dislocation is already healed, and therefore let the sick person go."
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	"And if you see any sign of weakness, then return and splint that again, and extend it according to your first method, and let it rest for three days."
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	"And after removing the splint, let them walk with support on crutches for a few days until they are strengthened."
Capitol .xxxii.	"Chapter XXXII."
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	"On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder blade."
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	"The shoulder blade is dislocated in three ways: for it is dislocated at the outer parts, and at the inner parts, and more often at the upper and rear parts; but it is not dislocated at the front."
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	"And the sign of dislocation of the shoulder blade is that when you tell the sick person to apply their thigh to the hip, they are unable to do so."
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	"And the reduction of all kinds of dislocation is as follows: make the sick person lie on their right side, so that they can extend their thigh if possible; press their knee against the outer face of the shoulder blade, and place their foot between your feet; then apply both palms to the shoulder blade of the sick person, and press firmly with your elbows over the shoulder blade of the sick person while another assistant extends their foot until the shoulder blade returns to its proper place."
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	"And the sign of reduction is that the thigh adheres to the hip with ease and effortlessly."
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And then splint it and make the thigh adhere to the hip, then bind them together with a bandage for three days or four, then remove the splints."
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	"Then let the sick person not walk until they are healed and strengthened."
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	"But if you cannot reduce it, then apply strong traction with ligatures as described in the treatment of hip dislocation."
Capitol .xxxiii.	"Chapter XXXIII."
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	"Treatment of an ankle dislocation."
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	"The talus bone may sometimes be displaced by minor trauma, and sometimes it becomes completely dislocated, with dislocation occurring either internally or externally."
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	"And the sign of talus bone dislocation is that sometimes the talus becomes swollen at the joint where it has dislocated."
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	"The treatment for removing it is easy reduction; it should be extended gently with hands and gradually returned."
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	"Furthermore, in the treatment of it when it is displaced according to completion, you should make the patient lie on their right side, and have a strong and able servant hold them firmly by the hips from behind."
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	"And appropriately, place your right hand on the upper part of their thigh and your left hand lower down towards their knee."
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	"And properly pull the leg towards you with your right hand, and appropriately grasp it twice with your left hand, and then extend it with your left hand; and press firmly on the joint of the leg with your right hand without force."
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	"And perform this procedure twice as we have discussed."
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	"And then press firmly on the joint of the leg with your hand for the third time; you are now at the knee."
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	"So if it returns in one or two attempts with this method, and the leg feels right again, that is good. But if not, then repeat the procedure until it returns."
